What You’ll Do

The Business Analyst for Corporate Development/Corporate Development Integration is responsible for leading and carrying out critical processes and frameworks around financial planning, resource planning, supplier/vendor management, and business operations. This role relies on strong relationship building and self-starter attitude to successfully collaborate on many deliverables integral to Cisco’s Corporate Development portfolio.

As the Business Analyst, your key responsibilities include

You will drive planning, forecasting, scenario analysis, and validation for functional, deal, and investment budgets.

You will work with deal leads/integration leads to define, plan, procure, and measure resourcing for significant investment/acquisition/divestiture activities

You will develop and steward corporate development supplier/vendor management framework, methodology, metrics, and analytics (SOW tracking, regular business reviews, overall health scorecard, resource optimization)

You will own operational spend activities (invoicing, accruals, headcount tracking, expense allocation/tracking) and own highly confidential data

You will deliver assessments and executive summaries to senior leadership and cross-functional deal/integration sponsors/teams

You will partner with Corporate Development Integration Business Operations, Investment Portfolio team, M&A Finance, and Corporate Development Finance

You will take on and drive new initiatives/projects as needed

Who You’ll Work With

With 200+ successful acquisitions, Cisco is recognized as an industry leader in acquisition integration. The Corporate Development Integration (CDI) team plays a key execution role in Cisco’s innovation, revenue and margin growth by maximizing the value of acquisitions, orchestrating divestitures, and engaging in JV’s and partnerships. We are a diverse, high-performing, dynamic team focused on gaining maximum value from Cisco’s acquisitions and other related transactions. We impact senior executive leaders and workstream leads from across Cisco business who are passionate about Cisco’s acquisition integration success.

Who You Are
You have a BS degree in Business, Finance, or equivalent; with 3-5 years working in Finance or equivalent role
You have effective teamwork, communication, and analytical skills with flexibility to self-motivate and work independently with attention to detail
You prioritize/manage competing requirements to meet deadlines and deliver outcomes with good judgment and discretion
You effectively resolve issues, solve complex business problems, and always seek/envision opportunities for improvement/transformation
You are well-versed in Excel, Smartsheet, Business Objects, GL, P&L

Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

position: Business Analyst - Alexa Shopping, Alexa Shopping
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

At Alexa Shopping, we strive to enable shopping in everyday life. We allow customers to instantly order whatever they need, by simply interacting with their Smart Devices such as Amazon Show, Spot, Echo, Dot or Tap. Our Services allow you to shop, no matter where you are or what you are doing, you can go from 'I want that' to 'that's on the way' in a matter of seconds. We are seeking the industry's best to help us create new ways to interact, search and shop. Join us, and you'll be taking part in changing the future of everyday life.

Are you looking for a role in one of the most innovative areas at Amazon? Do you thrive in building something from scratch only to watch it grow and impact the millions of customers who use your product on a daily basis? Invention has become second nature at Amazon, the pace of innovation is only accelerating, and the breadth of our businesses expanding. Amazon’s growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to promote new products, unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems in ambiguous environments.

The Amazon Alexa Shopping Customer Activity & Valuation (CAV) team is looking for a motivated Business Analyst to join us in our mission of re-inventing the way customers shop. You will work closely with leadership, program managers, product managers, data engineers, data scientists, and product marketing to drive automated analytics, attribution, reporting, and decision making. If you love working with huge data sets and delivering the insights you discover through business intelligence reporting and automated systems, then this is the job for you. You'll be challenged, have fun, and make history driving the intersection of ambient computing and retail commerce.

Key job responsibilities

Job responsibilities
Own key Alexa Shopping Goals’ instrumentation responsibilities to measure customer’s shopping success in interacting with Alexa.
Design and drive business critical work streams to bring a programmatic focus to improving these metrics and goals, some of which may be SVP/VP goals.
Collaborate with tech, business & ops teams and influence them in order to deliver best product and features to improve toppling goal metrics.
Provide updates to Alexa shopping leadership team on key programs, processes and metrics.
Build and drive mechanisms to ensure delivery on key actions from leadership reviews.
Highlight any bottlenecks (e.g. Telemetry miss) that block progress, propose potential solutions and drive implementation to meet and exceed program goals.

Basic Qualifications

5+ Years of industry experience
Experience gathering business requirements and discerning importance
Stakeholder management skills and ability to preserve time to work on strategic projects despite competing demands
Strong experience using industry standard business intelligence and data engineering tool(s) to interact with, extract, transform, and load data
Advanced SQL skills with experience analyzing large-scale, complex, unstructured datasets
Experience developing within and contributing to a large-scale data lake environment as a data creator
Experience with visualization tools such as QuickSight, Looker, Tableau, Excel
Bachelor's of Science or higher in Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Sciences, or a similar field or equivalent industry experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in a lean, successful start-up or on a new product team where continuous innovation is desired and ambiguity is the norm
Experience with advanced statistical analysis and modeling
Experience owning business/program outputs and goals
Experience working with Git/repository workflows
Experience with one or more modern programming languages

Workplace Operations & Supply Chain, through our services and applications, provide an employee experience that drives innovation, collaboration, productivity, and transparency. Our Continuous Improvement team identifies transformation opportunities in our shared services to improve our employee experience.

Our internal clients span supply chain, facilities, capital and design, global real estate, employee operations, collaboration solutions, and workplace engineering and innovation.

You will gather and analyze information, formulate, and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You will also present results to our senior leaders and implement recommendations in collaboration with engineering and business teams.

We'll Trust You To
Identify business needs, design processes, and leverage technology to ensure Bloomberg employees can continue to deliver best in class products to our customers
Work on project-based engagements end to end: from problem identification to solution design and implementation strategy. Our team's success is contingent on realized and quantified business results.
Drive automation and simplification across workflows in the organization while embedding data and analytics to support smarter decision making
Manage key integration elements to ensure the needed processes, technology and organizational touchpoints are addressed
Deliver projects with an unyielding focus on quality results (analyses and deliverables)
You Will Need To Have
3+ years of experience in consulting, business management, analytics, FP&A
Experience working in an agile framework
Strategic mindset with deep intellectual curiosity
Exceptionally strong client management and executive-level communication skills
Ability to define and drive a delivery roadmap inclusive of milestone deliveries
Self-starter and must be able to perform duties with moderate to low supervision
Anticipates and resolves issues with a sense of urgency
Adapts to a rapidly changing business and technical environment
Superior command of PowerPoint and Excel
Experience with Python for data analysis preferred
Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

position: Senior Business Analyst, Prime Video Channels
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The role may be located in New York City, Seattle, or Los Angeles. We are looking for a talented media industry analyst who is passionate about applying analytical, data-driven, strategic thinking to drive crucial business decisions for our growing Prime Video Channels business. Prime Video Channels brings wide selection of great content to Amazon customers around the world.

Prime Video is fast becoming one of the major global players in digital entertainment. We are changing the way millions of customers enjoy movies and TV shows through Amazon Prime, new releases for rent or purchase, and subscription through Prime Video Channels. Prime Video Channels, launched in 2015, distributes video channels OTT including Showtime, Starz, Acorn TV, PBS Masterpiece and many more channels without a cable subscription.

Key job responsibilities

Review data and deliver insights to inform content selection and customer acquisition / engagement / retention decisions.

Work closely with Content Acquisition Managers, Marketing, Insights, and Strategic Planning on both ongoing and one-off analyses.

Develop actionable insights that make impactful differences.

Present insights and findings across complex and varied data points to senior leadership in a clear and succinct written or verbal format.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
5+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Experience in SQL
Experience with Microsoft Excel
Preferred Qualifications
2+ years experience in strategy consulting or similar role
2+ years experience in media/entertainment
Experience taking variable internal and external data sets and reconciling into useful insights

JOB SUMMARY

The Business Analyst / Developer will be a project team member in the rollout of new applications across AMC Networks as part of projects driving business process change.
The Business Analyst / Developer must be able to work independently with oversight, guidance and coaching from their London based manager.
The candidate must be able to follow direction, work & learn quickly in a fast-paced environment and work tactfully and professionally with business users.
The role will involve different business solutions over time and currently includes working with Conga contracting software, Docusign workflow software and (of lower priority) Microsoft PowerBI. The work involves prototyping changes with users, carrying out testing and migrating changes to Production. As such some experience of basic configuration of a business workflow application is essential.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Learn new business systems to be able to configure workflows
Providing user support: Recording, tracking and resolving queries
Provide 1:1 and small group trainings
Lead meetings/workshops to document requirements and outcomes
Follow up with project team members on requirements, business processes (“as is” and “to be”) and document use cases to ensure business needs will be met by new systems
Produce project documentation, such as requirements documents, rollout plans and test plans
Perform unit testing and coordinate user acceptance testing
Participate in project meetings and serve as liaison between system owners and business users
Update, implement and maintain processes and/or procedures
Work independently on multiple tasks with commitment and willingness to see issues through to resolution

QUALIFICATIONS (Required & Preferred)
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in business analysis and / or application development
Must have at least 6 months of basic business application workflow experience – Docusign workflow or some form of contracting legal system / financial approval commitment system is not essential but of benefit
Experience of successfully delivering some level of business process change, working with internal company staff members
Organized, professional and with a “can do” attitude

KEY RELATIONSHIPS
Business users
Legal/Payroll/HR/Finance/IT staff
3rd party vendors

About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you enjoy solving complex business problems, transforming data into information, and using that information to influence business decisions? Are you able to form a picture and tell a story based on what the numbers are saying? Do you have experience joining data sets from disparate sources in order to do so? If so, this opportunity may be for you.

The Global Risk Management & Claims organization is seeking a Business Analyst to be part of the team. The ideal candidate will be excited about understanding and implementing new and repeatable processes and providing data to the businesses we support. You will partner with key stakeholders to dig deep into the business challenges to understand and identify insights. This will enable us to use data and metrics to develop the standards needed to improve our ability to scale this program. You will be comfortable delivering/presenting these recommended solutions by gathering business requirements that will be immediately useful to improve the business decision-making process. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical skills as well as an outstanding business acumen. The ideal candidate knows and loves our customers (internal and external) and will work back from the customer to create structured processes. You are an expert in partnering and earning trust with operations/business leaders to drive these key business decisions.

Virtual location flexibility dependent on candidate experience and proximity to key stakeholders.

Key job responsibilities
Analyze data looking for trends that help the business team to drive our strategy
Work with teams to develop tactical reports and dashboards which help guide the team with to drive key business decisions. You will own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc.
Forecasting (as appropriate)
Data integrity/data cleanliness/data maintenance
Research, identify, gather and curate data from multiple sources to provide a more complete picture of our outputs
Identify root causes of data issues and develop solutions
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks
Analyze historical data to identify trends and insights
Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions
Own the development and maintenance of new and existing artifacts focused on analysis of requirements, metrics, and reporting dashboards
Partner with operations/business teams to consult, develop and implement metrics, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements to meet business needs

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Science, Finance, Information Systems or related technical field
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of experience in analytics, business analysis, data science or similar job function
Experience working with SQL, VBA, Excel, Access
Experience with tools like Tableau and QuickSight
Experience in working with large datasets
Database and data warehouse knowledge
Experience developing custom reporting solutions
Agile and Waterfall project management skills
Experience with project management platforms like Playbook, Amazon Projects, Jira, Rally
Resident of Colorado: The pay range for this position in Colorado is $63,700 – 111,500/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site. Posted by
Debra Ziemann
Talent Acquisition Manager at Self Esteem Brands, LLC
Send InMail
Self Esteem Brands, LLC – the parent company of Anytime Fitness, LLC, Waxing the City Worldwide, LLC, Basecamp Fitness, LLC, The Bar Method Franchising, LLC and Stronger U, is seeking a Business Analyst within our Marketing team. At Self Esteem Brands, we offer a fun, fast-paced, inspirational environment. Look forward to work on Mondays! Regularly voted “Best Places to Work in Minnesota,” we offer a culture like no other.

Summary
Help us be more consumer centric and make strong data driven decisions for all our brands. Looking for a naturally curious Business Analyst with a passion for business, marketing, and operational analytics. You will provide strategic insights derived from consumer data, sales, marketing, operations, and competitive intelligence to drive business-critical strategy.
The Business Analyst will provide support to Self Esteem Brands by creating compelling and easy to use reports for KPIs and other relevant business metrics. Come join a team of consumer obsessed data nerds who want to raise the self-esteem of the world!
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES include:
Aggregates and performs analysis on business data for brand and product teams. Analyze cause-effect relationships between marketing and business operations, customer behavior, synthesizing relevant data to provide recommendations for strategy and tactics.
Integrates data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensures data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed.
Develop report to track KPIs and relevant business metrics to help inform data-driven business decisions and leverage structured / analytical thought processes to provide interpretations and recommendations based on the data.
Successfully tell stories from disparate data sources, analyzing and building models, utilizing data to design business goals, and structuring visualizations.
Presenting clear, concise insights and stories to leadership, strategy, and internal partners to communicate recommendations derived from insights.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required 2+ years relevant analytics experience working in a business environment
Naturally curious and comfortable with business metrics. Must have working knowledge of business performance metrics like LTV and key driver analysis.
Must have working knowledge of database querying/ SQL, data analysis tools such as Alteryx (ideal), R, or Python and reporting/ data visualization skills using software like Tableau and Power BI.
Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming techniques, collect data from a variety of sources, generate insights from the available information.
Analytical and problem-solving skills, identify patterns in data, assess data quality
Create mechanisms for exploring structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
Ideal candidate will have familiarity building dashboards and reporting in Power BI or must be willing to learn platform quickly.
Familiarity with predictive analytics, hands-on experience building models definite plus
Solid written and verbal communication skills and ability to work cross functionally at all levels of a multi-brand, shared services environment.

About Citi

Citi has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

About Citi Securities Services

Citi Securities Services supports the world’s leading asset managers, institutional investors, and financial institutions. We provide a full suite of solutions in over 60 proprietary custody markets and 23 fund domiciles, including: custody, clearing, asset servicing, fund administration, ETF services, middle ofﬁce, agency securities lending, collateral management, transfer agency, and ﬁduciary services. The combination of our global end-to-end service capabilities and Citi VelocitySM Clarity, our industry-leading data platform, enables our clients to futureproof and grow their business, while mitigating risks and reducing their infrastructure cost.

This role is for an analyst to work on a high-performing sales team. We are seeking a hard-working individual to support our sales and client relationship efforts. You will enjoy a fast paced culture and collaborative team - all inside a growth business. Further, your career development will be comprised of both structured and on-the-job training.

Learn the different components and products of securities services

Trading Analytics is part of a comprehensive solution provided by IHS Markit’s Trading Service division that helps investment managers and broker-dealers evaluate the execution services received from counterparties to reduce transaction costs and protect alpha.

The Transaction Cost Analysis (TCA) product within Trading Analytics has over 90 benchmarks that helps investment managers deconstruct the implicit costs into multiple categories including but not limited to spread, market impact, and opportunity costs. These implicit costs together with the explicit costs provide investment managers an overall view of the total costs incurred on the trade. The product currently covers Equities, ETF’s, Equity Options, FX, Government and Sovereign Bonds, Loans, Money Market Instruments, Asset Backed Securities and Credit Default Swaps and is looking to enter new asset classes.

The Best-Execution product within Trading Analytics helps Buy-Side and Sell-Side firms comply with Best-execution regulations such as Regulation NMS (in United States) and MIFID II (Europe). The Trading Analytics suite of products provides significant value to clients that require a cross-sectional analysis of their trading activity.

The Product Team is responsible for evaluating and understanding the evolving analytics marketplace, devising the core vision for future products, designing these products, writing specifications, and working with the Development and QA teams to take the products to market.

Your Team

You will be working for the Trading Services Product Management Team. Part of the team is currently situated in the North America and rest are located in London (UK).

The Trading Services team currently works on our Best-Execution and Transaction Cost Analytics product suite for US, EMEA and APAC Buy-Side and Sell-Side clients.

You Role

Work in the product management team to gather and frame requirements, working with the Product Manager, Head of Product, Sales, and Business Development
Proactively identify gaps in the current product and propose solutions to help close them
Understand the TCA and Best-ex landscape, perform market research to come up with new product requirements
Work on proof of concepts to test out new product adoption rates
Demo products after go-live to internal users such as Business Development, Sales, and Marketing

About You

Do you enjoy creating innovative solutions and solving problems? You will contribute and make an impact towards our current product expansion goals as we look to enter new asset classes and help our clients assess their trading performance in these asset classes.

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Financial Engineering, Computer Science or Statistics
2+ years working as Business Analyst and Product Management in gathering and writing requirements
Experience working in at least one of Equities, Fixed Income or FX asset classes
Prior experience managing small-medium scale projects to completion
Proficient at excel other such technical analysis tools
Building proof of concept designs and products
Experience with the JIRA and AGILE Methodology of software development
Must be able to work with cross functional teams to gather and present product requirements
Strong attention to detail and work ethics
Strong communication skills

Company Profile

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethics. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

About Third Party Program Management

The Third Party Program Management (TPPM) group is a dedicated first line of defense function within Reengineering & Expense Management (REM) and the Finance division, established to more effectively manage risks associated with Morgan Stanley's use of internal and external Third Parties to provide goods and services. TPPM is part of REM alongside Accounts Payable and Firmwide Sourcing.

TPPM's Key Objectives Are
Enable a firm-wide Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) program
Implement a firm-wide TPRM strategy, processes and tools
Execute due diligence and ongoing monitoring
Implement clear, consistent information and reporting to identify, measure, monitor and manage firm-wide risks
Maintain compliance with regulatory requirements
The Position

Role: Business Analyst, TPPM, Level II Tools, Process & Communications Support

Location: New York, NY

Reports to: TPPM Tech Lead (New York)

Scope: Global TPPM Operations

Responsibilities

The role will be responsible for working with TPPM team to provide business analysis support and drive/support procedural efficiencies as well as process and tool enhancements. This role will be responsible for developing business requirements and liaising with internal operations and technology teams. This role will also provide project support, data analysis and training as required. The candidate will ensure that all tasks are performed consistently in accordance with the Firm's Third Party Risk Management Framework and established procedures.

Specific Responsibilities Include
Assist Product Owner in all facets of Agile build of technology solutions and enhancements
Elicit, analyze, write Business requirements documents (including Agile stories, supporting documentation) and plan/conduct UAT testing
Own and maintain key solution documentation including data dictionary, integration summary, etc.
Maintain project plans
Develop and maintain reports of technology solution metrics, Key Performance Indicators
Provide Level 1, 2 support for troubles and queries. Liaise with Technology to resolve issues.
Support Operations staff
Work with external system owners to understand and document rules of engagement for system integrations.
Write and deliver training materials for technology related initiatives
More Specifically, Qualifications Must Include

The successful candidate will have experience in Vendor Risk Management and/or sourcing, with experience in working with teams across territories.
Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in global organizations, preferably in Banking or Financial Services organizations
Strong interest and ability to learn new concepts, ways of working
Creative thinker strongly grounded in components of Morgan Stanley Mission and Vision
Ability to manage multiple projects at one time
Ability to translate complex technical concepts to business leadership, staff
Experience with business requirement writing, Agile stories preferred

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

At Amazon, we're working to create the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven leaders to help us deliver great customer experiences. We are looking for a dynamic, customer-obsessed and innovative Business Analyst to join our Amazon Private Brands team. Amazon’s Private Brands is a fast-growing global business that is rapidly expanding our brand offering to delight our customers.

This role requires an individual with excellent understanding of SQL and query development, good business acumen and the ability to work with quantitative and business teams. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a key role on the development of key business metrics related to the Private discovery products. You will need to interface with a diverse set of stakeholders including - business, data engineering, financial analyst, product management and SDE teams. To be successful, you should demonstrate the ability to balance excellent analytical and technical skills while clearly driving communication and collaboration with other key partners. As a member of the team, you will also have the opportunity to leverage your passion for data science to create high impact solutions. The key tasks would be to analyze traffic, customer & other business data to help teams prepare for business reviews. He/she will be responsible for helping business stake holder with growing the overall business providing decision support through data analysis and business insights. You will also work closely with internal business teams to extract or mine information from our existing systems to create new analysis, and expose data from our group to wider teams in intuitive ways.

This role is open to hiring in Seattle, Santa Monica or other Amazon offices.

Key job responsibilities
Deep Dive and Advanced Analytics – Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity to help private brands discovery products create higher business impact
Metrics and Reports - Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Ensure data accuracy by validating data for new and existing tools
Helping identify process improvement opportunities to build streamlined and scalable solutions
Help envision & execute the automation agenda
Presenting written business recommendations that will help shape the direction of the business
Becoming part of a team of trusted advisors throughout an entire business unit
Partner with data engineering teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.
Proactively identify opportunity areas for deep dive investigations and future program development.
Define the business problem and solution approach autonomously with limited guidance.
Prepare and deliver business requirements reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks.
Excellent writing skills, to create artifacts easily digestible by business and tech partners
A day in the life

In this role time will be balanced between working with stakeholders to understand business and technical problems, developing new data solutions, and reviewing completed solutions. In any given day you can expect to have 2-3 hours of meetings split between stakeholders and meeting with other DE/BIEs. During time not in minutes you will be developing new data solutions with most time spent in SQL, Excel and Quicksight.


Basic Qualifications
3+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Proficiency in SQL
Advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.)
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced, ambiguous and rapidly changing environment
Proven ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner to executives
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner
Proven analytical problem solving skills in a complex space, attention to detail, and exceptional communication & organizational skills
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Advanced technical or business degree (MS or MBA)
Prior experience in analytic modeling and advanced ability to draw insights from analysis supported by data
Proven ability to clearly communicate insights and influence buy-in to stakeholders & senior leaders
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data
Proficiency in 1+ programming language (Python, R, etc)
4+ years' experience in SQL and Excel (including Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.)
3+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis
Prior experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting as well as with data visualization (Tableau, QuikSight, Power BI)
Prior experience in analytic modeling and advanced ability to draw insights from analysis supported by data
Proven ability to clearly communicate insights and influence buy-in to stakeholders & senior leaders
Experience working with data engineering teams

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Our team helps safeguard the quality of the Alexa user experience. We are quality watchdogs, performing analytics over all Alexa interactions, while creating innovative approaches to monitoring and tooling. We own central metrics for detecting customer issues, and support the entire Alexa organization as analytics SMEs.

We're looking for a talented Business Analyst who is excited and passionate about delivering advanced analytics and having a direct influence the Alexa user experience. You can be a champion of the customer by creatively surfacing insights on their behalf and by turning those insights into action.

Alexa is shaping the future of voice recognition and cloud-based content/services. Alexa is the name of the Amazon cloud service and the brain that powers Echo, answering questions, playing music, reading the news and more — instantly. Our ambitious goal is to deliver a flawless experience to our customers.

The Business Analyst enjoys working with data, and is good at it. You can create clear and effective reports and data visualizations, and can partner with customers to answer key business questions. You are a creative problem solver who cares deeply about what our customers experience. You are a highly analytical, team-oriented individual with excellent communication skills. In this visible role, you will provide reporting, analyze data, make sense of the results and be able to explain what it all means to key stakeholders - whether they be other analysts, engineers, marketers, product managers, or VPs. You are a self-starter while being a reliable teammate, you are comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, you are able to see the big picture while paying meticulous attention to detail, you know what it takes to build trust, you are curious and thrive on learning. You will become a subject matter expert in the world of Alexa quality analytics.

Key job responsibilities

This role has ongoing opportunities to display skills in the following areas:
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
Define requirements for understanding and reporting on customer behavior, and work with technical teams and product managers to integrate into their development schedules.
Demonstrate good judgment in solving problems, as well as identifying problems in advance and proposing solutions.
Exercise your strong desire and ability to dive deep.
Translate findings into compelling recommendations, polished deliverables, and actionable programs.
Present findings to partner teams and organizational leadership.
Derive actionable insights and routinely present recommendations from your analyses.
Partner with and empower product teams to analyze the customer experience their product offers.
Produce high-quality documentation for processes and analysis results.
A day in the life

This role works with many Alexa partner teams on improvements to the Alexa CX. In a given day, you could collaborate with the Communications, Music and Smart Home teams on prioritization of improvements specific to their domains, meet with international partners on defect reduction knowledge sharing processes, prepare accuracy reporting for a business review, and/or discuss monitoring tools requirements with our team engineers. Another day, you may clear your morning calendar to dig deeper on a complex analysis, and in the afternoon work with a new source of data to determine its value to analytics. Later in the week, you review the results of your deep-dive and value-analyses with the rest of the team before sharing more broadly.

About The Team

This is a close-knit, highly collaborative team. We know each other and each other's work. Every team member has clear areas of ownership, while benefiting from each other's help and feedback to raise the quality and correctness of our results. We have a well-earned reputation for cross-group collaboration and focus on the needs of our customers.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field
5+ years of relevant work experience in business analytics, business intelligence, market research or related field
Advanced data analysis knowledge and experience, with strong MS Excel and SQL skills
Experience in data mining, ETL, and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Strong project management, organizational, and collaboration skills
Exceptionally strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format
Ability to prioritize and work well in an ambiguous environment with competing demands
Preferred Qualifications
Graduate degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
Experience building dashboards, reports, and/or tools through BI Platforms such as QuickSight, Power BI or Tableau
Experience evaluating data integrity

This role will assist the Systems Manager in supporting the finance teams in all financial systems (SAP, Hyperion, SAP BPC, etc.)The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and have a willingness to learn all financial systems quickly to become the subject matter expert for the financial systems. Additionally, the candidate should be comfortable with a fast paced environment where the candidate has to wear multiple hats at the same time. An ideal candidate will also have the ability to think critically, comfortable explaining complex financial system items to finance users in a simplified way, and great verbal and written communication. The position would be primarily focused on the North America market with advancements opportunities into Global operations.

Key Responsibilities
Be the liaison/primary contacts between the finance teams and the financial system’s technical teams
Support the finance teams by answering all of their questions about the financial systems as well as identify and fix any system issues that come up from the finance teams.
Develop and maintain detailed training guides (and high level overviews) to be distributed to all finance users that will include SAP BPC, SAP BW/Analysis for Office (AO) and various processes within SAP.
Responsible for training all finance users both in person and remotely in financial systems ranging from SAP BPC, SAP BW/Analysis for Office (AO), Hyperion, and SAP.
Assist the Financial Systems Manager to improve processes and efficiencies through financial systems and reporting for the finance teams.
Work with the local finance teams to create custom reporting solutions through Excel and the use of the forecasting tool SAP BPC (and/or local market forecasting tool) and the reporting suite SAP BW / Analysis for Microsoft Excel.
Ensure all files (linked to financial systems and offline for local finance) are designed efficiently and where needed re-design, develop, test, and deploy new efficient reporting.
Draft up proposals for process and efficiency improvements for the financial teams to reduce overall time spent on a task and/or budgeting process.
Work with the Financial Systems Manager to implement the process and efficiency improvements.
Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance and/or a related field
6+ months' Enterprise Systems experience (ie. SAP, SAP products, SAP BPC, Analysis for Microsoft Excel (AO) and/or Hyperion)
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Power Point)
Comfortable working with large data sets, pivot tables and performing excel formulas (vlookup, sumifs etc.)
Comfortable working with and ability to keep extremely sensitive data confidential is required
Ability to investigate, analyze and solve problems as well as clearly communicate results through requirement documents and verbal communications
Ability to be proactive and solution-oriented with the ability to think ahead to make proposals and recommendations to deliver solutions
Ability to be patient and understanding with the ability to explain complicated technical situations to finance users of all levels of management in multiple easy to understand ways
Ability to think critically to determine the best solution for the finance teams
Willingness to learn and become the subject matter expert in all financial systems using company training resources and googling where needed.
Ability to manage and adjust their working schedule as needed based on deadlines
Knowledge of excel VBA (Macros) preferred but not required

Why Join Teladoc Health?

A New Category in Healthcare:  Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.

Job Id: 22473845

Business Overview:

Citi’s Global Spread Products Business is part of the greater Global Markets and Securities Services division of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group. The Spread Products business is a global business with a presence in eleven countries across North and Latin America, Europe, Asia and Japan primarily focusing on corporate, municipal, and mortgage-backed bonds, loans and credit default swaps as well as structured products and financings. Global Spread Products primary function is to facilitate market liquidity for its institutional investor client base across both developed and emerging markets.

Key Responsibilities:

The Global Spread Products Business manager sits within the GSP Chief Operating Office as part of the CAO & Product Development Organization. The role supports the Sales and Trading as well as the Financing and Securitization aspects of our GSP franchise. The role is responsible for establishing and driving business strategy and priorities (in conjunction with Business Heads) to ensure delivery of strategic business initiative.

The ideal candidate should have a well-diversified background with a successful track record of leadership, experience, and performance. The candidate should also have strong product knowledge and understanding of important strategic transactions and have the ability to navigate the firm as circumstances arise to facilitate this business.

Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to build consensus on strategy and execution are a key component of the role. Other key responsibilities of the role include talent planning and development, optimization of business resources, development of new initiatives including product expansion and target market efforts, and strong and consistent coordination of decisions across the business and support functions.

This role may require travel but will be based in Tampa.

Key Responsibilities Include:

The successful execution of this role requires the incumbent to develop a wide range of financial, business, and inter-personal skills, the ability to multi-task, and to function comfortably amidst conflicting objectives in a high-pressure environment.
Day-to-day business management and administrative duties
Initiate and execute short, medium and long term projects to achieve the business objectives of the division. Projects may be related to revenue growth, expense reduction, control processes, or general process improvement
Ensure a robust governance, oversight, and control framework exists and is in line with corporate policies & regulation.
Maintain detailed control documentation, procedures, key metrics and audit evidence.
Working alongside the senior Business Managers, to liaise with Business Heads to produce strategic presentations for internal and external audiences.
Working with the business and support areas (including Middle Office, Operations, Audit, Compliance, Finance, Technology and Legal) to ensure a robust control infrastructure is in place and to act as a key point of contact between business and stakeholders.
Work with other Business Managers, the Regulatory Reform team, and stakeholder groups to understand and to prepare the Business for regulatory change. Trade and client analysis are central to this function as is an understanding of legal and regulatory documentation.
Ensure the accuracy and completeness of key business data (volumes, EV, revenue, expenses, capital, etc).
Working with Product Technology teams as required ensuring that Product, Regional, and JV projects are represented correctly and delivered in a timely manner. The projects will involve helping to integrate platforms, warehousing control documents and helping to build out any additional platform needs.
Assist in establishment of new business lines or enhanced product offerings including processes, booking models, and systems/infrastructure.
Help review budgets and preparation as needed, with oversight from the senior Business Manager, including expense management and review throughout the year. Individual will generally be supplied with key financial reports and operational metrics but must know how to interpret and integrate them into documents and presentations for senior consumption.
Build an understanding of the cost base of the Business & pursue opportunities for savings and efficiency, maximizing returns.
Work closely with the Markets Business Managers in all aspects of financial, compliance and regulatory activities.
Knowledge/Experience:
Experience in middle office, risk, audit, compliance or financial control,
Interest in and prior exposure to capital markets, and familiarity with financial institution regulation and policies.
Fixed Income products knowledge would be advantageous, and interest in learning about complex financial instruments, transactions, and client/market interactions is essential.
Experience within Citigroup in similar situations would be a plus
Skills:
Excellent analytic and creative problem-solving skills
Strong communication and listening skills
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to develop peer-like relationships with senior leaders throughout an organization
Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously
Focused attention to detail plus ability to see the big picture
Collaborative, team-oriented approach to problem solving
Project and process ownership; strong time management
Intellectual curiosity
Strong desire to achieve excellence
Experience in project management and process ownership
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office; experience with business intelligence tools (i.e. QlikView, Microstrategy, etc.) is a plus
Qualifications:
Degree preferred or sufficient industry experience
An interest in and prior exposure to capital markets, and familiarity with financial institution regulation and policies
Competencies:
Excellent written & verbal communication skills at all organizational levels
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to develop peer-like relationships with senior leaders throughout an organization
Proven ability to work in a team of diverse skill sets and cultures
Willingness and ability to interact with internal clients and support groups is critical to success.

Who we are

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. We are hiring in New York, NY! Join us at Wildcat for an exciting career as a Business Analyst.

MUST be vaccinated against COVID-19. Required to provide documentation during the Onboarding process.

Mission: To create opportunities for individuals with barriers to achieve economic well-being www.wildcatny.org.

Wildcat Service Corporation was founded in July 1972 by visionary social entrepreneur, Herb Sturz. It was the first organization in the United States to design and implement a transitional work program for unemployed persons with criminal convictions. Transitional employment helps individuals with barriers to employment acquire the habits, demeanor and experience necessary to work in the private or public sectors. Each year Wildcat helps thousands of individuals transition successfully from incarceration to their community so they can find jobs, build careers, and receive the training and guidance necessary for economic well-being.

Wildcat joined The Fedcap Group in 2011.

Wildcat http://www.wildcatnyc.org/ was founded over 40 years ago to provide a second chance to those involved in the criminal justice system. Today Wildcat is a vibrant, growing company continuing to make inroads into services for the justice involved.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Location: New York, NY

FLSA Status: Exempt

Position Type: Full-time

Purpose Summary

The responsibilities of this role include detailed analysis at the Fedcap's company and line of business levels, preparation of P&L reports, assist in the review of financial results, preparation of quarterly earnings analysis package, assistance with the annual budget and quarterly outlook processes. The Analyst will support a combination of reporting and analysis functions and assist in the development of key indicators/ratios to better analyze financial results. In addition, the Analyst will look to identify, communicate and implement process improvement opportunities to enhance reports and provide efficiencies in the management reporting process.

To be successful in this position, the employee should possess an ability to analyze different types of information and be able to communicate the results to senior management. They should have a detailed oriented mindset to ensure accuracy of data contained in management reports, as well as develop a good understanding of key drivers to provide pertinent financial analysis to management. The Analyst will display technical and functional competence in management reporting to ensure the accuracy and integrity of all management reporting.

Essential Job Functions
Provide administrative leadership for business functions in Wildcat Services
Analyze business systems, financial statements, and proposal drafts for review by the Executive Director
Prepare executive level presentations in Excel, Word, Visio, (and other related Office 365 applications), Salesforce, and Oracle
Prepare executive level business analysis of financial statements, Salesforce pipeline, and operational systems for Wildcat programs and services
Develop and implement a strategy and structure for gathering and reporting meaningful data the reflect the impact of outcomes for programs and services; including but not limited to Metrics That Matter.
Perform additional duties as assigned. This job description is not deigned to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities.
Requirements

Education And Experience
Bachelor's degree in related field minimum; Master's preferred.
Strong, demonstrable knowledge of financial analytics, budgeting and reporting.
Strong, demonstrable background in finance/accounting.
Ability to meet deadlines and work additional hours during peak sessions.
Ability to make suggestions to senior management based on analysis.
Ability to work independently.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Do you enjoy solving complex business problems, transforming data into information, and using that information to influence business decisions? Do you have a desire to make a major contribution to the future in the rapid growth seller market place? In this position, the individual will have significant input on improving the key business metrics and defining the various solutions to business problems.

As a member of our team, you'll use Scrum to manage your day-to-day workload and will talk with team members around the world on a daily basis. Orientation to lean towards policy and procedure.

Contract W2 Position (100 Remote), 1099 Talent Acquisition Specialist Tarun 6099526477

Are you passionate about data? Want to take a central role in forming ADP’s data journey?

ADP’s Data Office, responsible for driving the use of data throughout the company, is hiring a Lead Business Analyst to drive the formulation of company wide data reporting as well as being a key player in the newly formed Data Center of Excellence. We set to innovate and transform the use of data throughout all of ADP’s business units, establishing unified business metrics and reporting to drive business outcomes.

In this position, you will be responsible for creating uniform business metrics across the ADP business, collaborating closely with partners in various Business Units and countries around the world to drive consensus in how ADP measures itself. This will involve diving deep into the ADP data assets, understanding ADP’s business models as well as business outcomes to form KPIs, dashboards, and reports to be used by senior leadership. You will be working closely with business teams, analysts, engineering, finance, and more to bring a common view of measurement.

This is a startup within ADP, rapidly iterating, and looking to be a driver of transformation for the business. Bring your entrepreneurial hat and readiness to roll up your sleeves to get stuff done.

Our ideal candidate has deep data understanding, the good, real, messy kind; is excited about discovering and talking data, internally and externally; is able to closely collaborate, thoughtfully driving results with colleagues; is an analytical critical thinker, ready to challenge existing perspectives to build new products; obsesses over measurable outcomes to innovate and prioritize; and concisely communicates complex concepts.

What You'll Do

Project Leadership and Impact:
Lead a multi-function project team through rapid, data-driven iterations focused on outcomes.
Drive impact through all engagements with team members and extended team members - through deliveries and effectiveness.
Regularly report and present to leadership on progress and outcomes, provide recommendations and drive discussions.
Analytics Strategy And Go-To-Market
Drive, manage, and execute the analytics strategies ensuring alignment with the business goals.
Partner with business and analytics leaders across ADP, business stakeholders, and development teams at ADP, to bring to “market” and drive adoption of business metrics, reports, and dashboards.
Data and more Data
Push for a deeper understanding of ADP’s unique data assets across teams
Explore the data and drive new understandings
Customer Experience And Market Orientation
Define requirements by leveraging business and market data, external industry trends, and metrics to generate insights.
Understand competitors and the market to help identify new partnerships to broaden or enhance a product portfolio and reach.
Required Qualifications
6+ years' experience in an analytical capacity - Business Intelligence Analyst, Analytics Lead, Data Product Management, Data Science, Management Consulting, etc.
2+ years in collaboration centric roles - working closely with cross functional teams and partners, communicating complex ideas to stakeholders, reporting to management, etc.
Data wrangling and visualization knowhow; SQL a must, Python and Tableau a plus
Patience and dedication, with the ability to navigate complex environments through analytical capabilities and leadership style.
Proven ability to partner effectively across functions, with an exposure to complex organizations and the ability to create a shared measurement vision, a plus.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:
Bachelors or Advanced or its equivalent in education and experience with a Major Area of Concentration in Engineering, Business, or Math or equivalent technical experience

Salaried and hourly workers who work on average 32 or more standard hours per week:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Student Loan Repayment Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Are you passionate about working with data, driven to dive deep, and eager to make broad business impact? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment and enjoy transforming data into actionable recommendations? Are you obsessed about customers and data, and are you looking for an opportunity to combine the two? Here’s your opportunity! To meet the growing demand for Amazon Web Services, the Americas Solution Architects (SA) & Customer Solutions Managers (CSM) organization has grown significantly in recent years. We are now building our Strategy and Analytics team to help us operate at scale. This team is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and delivering insights from data and building tools that will help our SAs and CSMs serve our customers better.

We are seeking a professional who can operate with a startup mentality while partnering with managers and business leaders to deliver sound, data-backed recommendations and insights, identify areas of improvement and suggest and implement solutions.

The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, excited about generating insights that will influence the direction of the Americas technical organization. You will be curious and comfortable digging deep into data and developing core metrics to identify areas of improvement and partner with the business to find effective solutions. You will develop new ways to measure and track our performance, and improve the customer experience.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: - Subject matter expert – develop deep knowledge of the AMER SA/CSM goals including how they are calculated, which operational systems are used and what each role must do in order to create a complaint target attainment.
Perform detailed analysis of key business metrics and provide actionable insights
Partner with the business to model, design, and build solutions in Tableau, Excel and Quicksight.
Proactively seek out ways to improve processes and productivity, and make recommendations to support an organization scaling at a rapid pace

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or related field
3+ years of experience in data analysis
2+ years of experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.)
2+ years experience with at least one data visualization tool (Power BI, Tableau, QuickSight, or similar)
1+ years of experience using SQL
Able to work in a diverse team
Preferred Qualifications
MBA or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data
Experience with cloud-based databases and data lakes, especially those based on AWS technologies (e.g. Redshift).

Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Job ID: A1930045

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

At Amazon, our goal is to be earth’s most customer-centric company and to create a safe environment for both our Customers and our associates. To achieve that, we need exceptionally talented, bright, dynamic, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a talented business analyst to join the Restricted Products (RP) team.

This role will be a key member of the Science and Analytics team, responsible for driving analysis and insights to help make meaningful business decisions. As a Business Analyst, you will focus on improving the success within business functions by analyzing data, discovering and solving real world problems, building metrics and business cases to improve customer experience, and providing timely data support for escalations to mitigate risk. We are focused on your success and want to build future leaders within Amazon. A key component of the role is to identify process and system improvement opportunities by developing the right metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams. In addition, you will design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Lastly, you will enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.

This role requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities, deep knowledge of business intelligence solutions and outstanding business acumen. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space.

Key job responsibilities
Creating automated reports and dashboards with a combination of BI tools such as Tableau
Partnering with program team, Legal, and Tech stakeholders to understand challenges and provide analysis to help drive program success
Providing data support for business and cross-functional partners to address escalations and answer questions using PostgreSQL and AWS solutions
Uncovering trends and correlations through mining and analysis to develop insights that can help stakeholders to make effective decisions
Designing and executing analytical projects using statistical analysis
Develop scalable solutions/self-serve platforms that will provide data/KPIs to inform business decision making.
About The Team

The Restricted Products (RP) team's charter is to protect Amazon customers from products that are illegal, illegally marketed, unsafe, or otherwise prohibited by Amazon policies.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business, or related field
3+ years of professional experience in analytics, statistical data analysis, measurement & experimentation, or comparable experience
Hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large datasets
Proficient working knowledge of data mining using ETL, data warehouse as well as Excel
Prior experience with data visualization (Tableau, QuickSight, Power BI, etc.)
Excellent writing and critical analytic thinking
Effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Ability to dive deep and demonstrate attention to detail
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to use scripting languages such as Python or R to evaluate data
Experience with AWS services including S3, Redshift, EMR and Apache Spark
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations
Project management and execution under hard deadlines
Proven problem solving skills and sound judgement with regard to unstructured, uncertain problems

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1858489

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Trustworthy Shopping Experience

(TSE) is looking for a Business Analyst for the Escalation Management Program team (EMP). We are looking for customer obsessed, data driven professionals to join our growing team and solve some of the hardest problems for our customers. If you want operate at start up speed, and build programs and solutions that stop abuse on our catalog and protect our customers shopping experience, this might be the place for you.

Key job responsibilities

We’re looking for leaders who are passionate about providing exceptional services, think globally, and have the ability to innovative on behalf of Amazon and its Customers, are you that person?

Some of the key result areas include, but not limited to:
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards
Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business team
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Interacting with stakeholder teams to define data solutions and establish standard processes.
Working with science and engineering teams to track ongoing issues.
Build data processes to track the team’s overall efficiency.
Build on demand queries to support our investigations teams on executive level deep dives and detecting bad actors.
A day in the life

As a business analyst on our team, you would be responsible for driving deep insights about past and present executive escalations and global abuse trends, driving continuous improvement using the data. The person should have a detailed understanding of a business requirement or the ability to quickly get to the root cause of a particular business issue, and draft solutions to meet requirements or resolve the root problems. You will work closely with program managers, operations managers, research scientists and product managers to analyze massive data sets, identify areas to improve, define metrics to measure and monitor programs, and most importantly work with different stakeholders to drive improvements over time. You will also work closely with internal business teams to extract or mine information from our existing systems to create new analysis, and expose data from our group to wider teams in intuitive ways.

About The Team

Trustworthy Shopping Experience (TSE) strives to guarantee customers a trustworthy shopping and ordering experience so they can shop with confidence on Amazon.

To deliver on this trustworthy shopping experience, the Escalation Management Program team (EMP) is empowered with investigating suspicious or prohibited marketplace activities in order to protect Amazon customers, sellers, and brand owners worldwide. Our team works with executive stakeholders and program owners to stop malicious seller activity on our stores, track risk trends worldwide and eliminate store abuse and customer dissatisfaction at their root.

As part of this team, your decisions will not only be fundamental to helping protect customers and sellers but will help maintain the health of the Amazon catalog and product listings ecosystem.


Basic Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance or related field
4+ years’ experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
4+ years' experience using SQL and Excel (including Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.)
Prior experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting as well as with data visualization (Tableau, QuikSight, Power BI)
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's or Masters degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance or related field
5+ years' experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data
5+ year experience using SQL - advanced proficiency writing complex SQL statements and ability to manipulate a massive amount of data, creating dashboards/on demand reports. Advance proficiency with Excel (including Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, VBA/Macros, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.)
2+ years of experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, QuikSight, Power BI)
2+ years of experience with a modern programming language (e.g., R, Python, etc.)
Advanced working knowledge of data mining using, ETL, data warehouse
Experience using AWS analytical services (e.g., Redshift, Data Pipeline, EMR, Machine Learning, Kinesis)

position: Business Analyst - Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Alpharetta, Cleveland 1
details:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Location:

As part of our Americas Tax Technology Group (ATTG) you will be part of a technology organization that develops and maintains innovative solutions for our client-serving Tax professionals. ATTG professionals will partner with our Tax professionals to develop supporting technology such as digital/mobile tools to improve internal operations, application of Robotics Process Automation (RPA) to collect financial data, development of advanced financial dashboards, visualization, analytics, and reports. The Business Analyst role sits in the Solutions Delivery Pillar.

Essential Functions of the Job:
Responsible for partnering with Business Technology Leaders, Solution Delivery Leaders and Architects in the definition and delivery of long-term business and technology strategies for one or more portfolio(s) through the application of domain knowledge and enterprise analysis; fostering reuse and continuity throughout.
Plan and manage the BA approach; communicating, driving and managing the business analysis effort for the Portfolio throughout all phases of the ATTG project life cycle.
Lead a team of BAs assigned to assigned program/portfolio project(s), ensuring comprehensive business analysis is performed on all projects across the assigned Portfolio/Programs. Also will perform hands-on BA work directly as needed.
Actively review requirements traceability for impact and coverage analysis throughout the Portfolio.
Work with the Analysis Community of Practice to ensure consistent application of the Solutions Delivery and ATTG standards and methodologies and advise on exceptions.

Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:
Ability to clearly articulate both problems and proposed solutions
Proactive approach to identifying issues and presenting solutions and options, and where appropriate, leading to resolution
Ability to prioritize personal and team workloads to best meet organizational objectives

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working effectively and building relationships with and between teams, external vendors and internal clients at varying executive levels
Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change based on client needs
TAX or Finance domain knowledge
Experience leading other BAs to provide analysis and requirements, ensure consistency, accuracy and quality of BA deliverables on larger initiatives
Experience with Enterprise Analysis.
Expert on industry-standard, structured business analysis techniques (i.e., user stories, use cases, UML/logical modeling, BABOK, etc.) appropriately modifying according to the decided software development methodology (i.e., Agile, Iterative, SCRUM, RUP, Waterfall, etc.) in use. Experience with Agile desired.
Experience using, training and driving others to use requirements management, modeling, and change control software(s)

Supervision Responsibilities:
Provide supervision and direction to team members and staff
Delegate, coach, coordinate and lead co-workers and project team members
Responsible for assigning work and reviewing performance, requiring leadership of virtual teams

Other Requirements:
Occasional overnight travel may be required

Job Requirements:
A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience.
Master's degree preferred
10-12 years of relevant experience
Management experience a plus
CBAP or CBATL certification preferred.

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

What We Offer

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.
