249789BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Are you a stickler for getting things right? Do you have a knack for analyzing credit and firmwide risk? Do you know how to solve problems and manage projects efficiently? We are looking for someone like this who can help us:

survey, analyze and evaluate processes, products and

services

conduct requirements-gathering activities, like

evaluating services, using a variety of internal and

external data and conducting end user interviews

provide documentation of processes and business

Requirements

support business architects by describing the business

processes, including the organizational structures

involved

find and implement solutions
collaborate with Risk Methodology, Risk IT and

respective Finance counterparts to deliver the above tasks

support project management tasks

Your team
You’ll be working in the Credit Risk Change team in Nashville, covering Credit Risk & Firmwide Model Change. We are part of the wider Risk Control organization and work as agents of change for our Risk Control colleagues. We are primarily responsible for eliciting detailed business requirements relating to data sourcing, calculations, outputs, methodology and end-to-end controls which drive fundamental IT systems and process changes.

Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.

Your expertise

a Bachelor’s degree in STEM or Finance preferred
ideally 6+years of experience in a risk control or related

financial environment

knowledge of risk methodology, quantitative analysis,

treasury or finance related topics

strong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skills
previous exposure to project development/project

management approaches

exposure to working under the Agile methodology is a

plus

CCAR experience is a plus
an excellent communicator, with strong interpersonal

Skills

a flexible, resilient team player with a positive attitude

and adaptable, able to work across teams and functions

About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Nomura Overview

Nomura is a leading financial services group and the preeminent Asian-based investment bank with worldwide reach. Nomura provides a broad range of innovative solutions tailored to the specific requirements of individual, institutional, corporate and government clients through an international network in over 30 countries. Based in Tokyo and with regional headquarters in Hong Kong, London, and New York, Nomura employs over 27,000 staff worldwide. Nomura's unique understanding of Asia enables the company to make a difference for clients through three business divisions: retail, asset management, and wholesale (global markets and investment banking).

Change Management Overview

The Change Management Team manages major projects and provides business analysis and best practice approach for a large portfolio of initiatives. Projects range from front-to-back bookings flow for new products/businesses, regulatory changes, cross border flow streamlining, data and information management, to system and process improvement. Many of the projects entail systematic changes requiring new processes that generate data and information used by operations and enterprise data management to support the business. Purpose of this team is to oversee all projects and manage change management across all the lines of Operations.

The Primary Focus Of The Team Is To Apply a Structured Management Methodology Across Americas Operations Through The Below Key Functions
Partner with key business partners to execute operational strategy and effectiveness requiring organization, planning, execution and cross-functional
Perform BA/PM roles for top-prioritized initiatives (BRD, Gap Analysis, Risk Impact, UAT, Implementation)
Conduct front-to-back process reviews as needed
Facilitate working groups, forum and meetings from domestic to global participation
Optimization of current infrastructure and process to support business growth
The CMT Resource Will Focus On

Role Description / Areas of responsibility:
Understanding our operations workflows, processes, controls and data requirements
Facilitating and managing project implementation initiatives within our portfolio of programs
Following the global project guidelines and delivering necessary artefacts for each project (Initiation document, governance process, BRD, Budget tracking, project plan, UAT plan and scripts, RAID log, go- live runbook, and other artefacts as required)
Coordinating project discipline and process to conduct deep dive requirements and coordinate across changes in operational functions and processes
Delivering program updates to key stakeholders and managing meetings with regional and global stakeholders and SMEs
Joining Operations Change Management team is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to leverage their business analysis / project management and implementation experience as well as expand their business knowledge.
Key Contribution Areas Critical To Success
Genuine interest in business analysis within operations as well as systems applications and workflow implementations
Strong business analysis, project management organization and communication skills
Ability to manage stakeholders, through project lifecycle, institute joint application development sessions to firm requirements through to management of UAT
Manage change control procedures, and issue resolution efforts
Ability to de-synthesize information to build brief presentations for working groups and committees
Skills, Experience, Qualifications / Knowledge Required
Bachelor degree. Finance, or Technology and relevant experience with a focus in financial services, computer science or business management.
Strong data analysis, oral and written communication, best practices in SDLC and controls specific to business process analysis, testing, risk impact analysis and project management with strong organization skills
2 -7 years prior experience in business project management
Self Starter, driven and team player with ability to work with all levels of teams in a fast paced Capital Markets environment
Knowledge and understanding of the financial markets with focus on Operations functions and trade lifecycle
Desirable/ Nice to Have
Advanced Excel Skills, and Microsoft office power user
Regulatory body knowledge
Minimum 3 years experience in relevant discipline
Nomura is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Demonstrates proficiency in eliciting, analyzing and documenting requirements - business and technical. Performing impact analysis and gap analysis. Managing stakeholders, users and conducting requirement workshop. Mapping processes and use cases. Analyzing the business case. Guiding the technical teams and vendor teams, if applicable. Possesses excellent communication skills. Demonstrates problem solving skills and troubleshooting support for both pre-production and production issues.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience as a systems engineer, providing solutions and associated requirements for enterprise data applications - 2 years minimum.

Associated experience in troubleshooting issues in both pre-production and production environments is also required with the ability to create scripts necessary to perform troubleshooting and direct developers and testers as needed

Exposure with Telecom business ordering and sales domains.
Creating features and user stories following SAFe Agile processes.
Leading solutions to address business functions and working closely with Product Owners to ensure their objectives are met.
Ability to collaborate closely with engineers, developers, and testers across applications to deliver projects and address issues.
Ability to multi-task, handling project deliverables and issues across multiple projects in parallel.
Excellent written and oral communication skills

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Experience as a systems engineer, providing solutions and associated requirements for enterprise data applications - 2+ years

LeanKit, SAFe Agile Processes
RDBMS - Oracle; NOSQL Mongo, Cassandra
K2View product
Apache Kafka / DMaaP
Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform

About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Company Profile

At Morgan Stanley, we advise, originate trade, manage and distribute capital for governments, institutions and individuals, and always do so with a standard of excellence. We are a leading global financial services firm that conducts its business through three principal business segments—Institutional Securities, Wealth Management (WM), and Investment Management. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

Our WM business is one of the largest in the world with more than $2 trillion in client assets, $73 billion in lending balances, and nearly 16,000 Financial Advisors in 600+ offices across the U.S. Our Financial Advisors focus on delivering timely, customized solutions and services that help clients meet their financial and life goals. Our offering includes brokerage and investment advisory services, financial and wealth planning, access to credit and lending, cash management, annuities and insurance, and retirement services.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.

Department Profile

Global Banking Technology (GBT) is a dynamic and fast-paced area within the Firm’s WM Technology Division. We are responsible for creating innovative technology solutions for the Private Banking Group (PBG), one of the strategic growth areas of the Firm, providing cash management and lending products and services to our WM clients. This includes state-of-the-art technology for a nationwide network of Private Bankers and product specialists who work with Financial Advisors to provide access to products and services such as online banking, cards, deposit products, residential mortgages, and securities-based loans and tailored lending.

Position Description

The position is for a Technology Business Analyst/ Project Manager, focusing on support for Morgan U.S. Banks. These banks are independent national banks and wholly-owned subsidiaries of Morgan Stanley. Because of their national bank charters and ability to attract stable insured deposits, the Banks represent valuable franchise-enhancing strategic assets to the Firm.

The U.S. Banks Technology team is responsible for supporting Bank business and growth by managing the provision of technology within a regulatory-compliant, risk-managed framework in a cost-effective manner. The team is seeking an experienced Technology Risk Manager to provide ongoing monitoring of the Banks’ technology risk landscape as it pertains to the management of technology change implementation.

Responsibilities
Develop an understanding of the Banks’ business models and familiarity with technology services provided by the affiliate technology organization, as well as familiarity with active technology risk initiatives and their impact to each Bank
Perform due diligence reviews for technology assets as part of the Bank New Product Approval process
Understand potential control gaps and determine impact to Banks and lead the execution of control-related initiatives
Coordinate with development teams across the Firm, Firm technology control groups, Bank security officers, and Operational Risk to deliver on program objectives
Produce clear and concise presentation materials related to technology initiatives for quarterly technology governance forums, including updates for Board meetings
Keep management informed of progress and issues related to technology programs
Participate in technology and governance and risk forums to represent Bank interests
Assist with preparation of responses to technology–related regulatory requests
Required Skills
Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Finance, or Information Technology
7-10 years of prior experience in financial or banking services in a project management or business analyst role
Strong analytical skills with the ability to solve problems independently and drive tasks to completion
Good interpersonal skills, with an ability to navigate complex organizations and build relationships
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to summarize complex information clearly for senior technical and non-technical audiences
High level of attention to detail and focus on precision
High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters, and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
Familiarity with Agile project management methodology

Qualifications
Desired Skills
Practical knowledge of banking principles, products, and bank regulatory environment
Advanced Excel skills, including data import, pivot tables, lookups, and data analysis.
Proficiency with Jira for project and task management
Educational Qualification
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, Economics, or Finance

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Are you interested in being part of a high visibility, strategic team that directly impacts the Amazon Seller experience worldwide? We are looking for motivated self-starters that can work in a fast paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will be an analytical problem solver, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities and business acumen, with exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, vocally self-critical, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They will analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics and business cases to help business teams to make decisions.

The CAPE team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst with strong SQL skills to define and standardize reporting mechanisms that currently vary or do not exist. This position will be responsible for working with the team to build reports that will drive insights into root causes of defects in the process and help the process evolve through data driven decision making.

Responsibilities May Include
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Identify process and system improvement opportunities by monitoring existent metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal teams
Design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions
Supporting cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of the existent program implementation.
Driving Seller experience enhancement projects

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Supply Chain or related field
2+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role
Data proficiency and a mastery of SQL
3+ year of experience conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role
Master’s Degree in Economics, Business Analytics, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics or related quantitative field or MBA with a concentration in Quantitative Analysis.
Experience in Consumer hardware product development is a plus.

Fitch Group is seeking a Data Business Analyst to join the Chief Data Office (CDO) as part of the Data Strategy team. In this role, you will be responsible for both functional and technical analysis work across a variety of data-driven systems and related projects, identifying and documenting business needs and processes, and translating them into data and software requirements. We are looking for someone who can work collaboratively with business teams, product owners, the development teams and other stakeholders to research, elicit, analyze, validate and document requirements, and to ensure that those requirements reflect the true business needs of the stakeholders and end users. This position requires an individual who is business process and data-oriented, can understand and decompose complex processes and is able to effectively communicate when issues and challenges arise. The Chief Data Office (CDO) is a recently established and fast-growing global function reporting to the CEO of the Fitch Group, with a mission to drive innovation by transforming the way Fitch leverages data. This is an exciting opportunity to work alongside a team of passionate, excellence-driven data and technology professionals who are driving mission-critical change within the organization. The role will be based in New York.

Responsibilities
Drive engagement with business partners within one or more business organizations to obtain deep understanding of the business area and align data and technology solutions with business needs
Use a variety of techniques to understand business requirements, such as interviews, workshops, surveys, site visits, and storyboards.
Shape business requirements by making recommendations and suggesting alternatives to proposed solutions
Identify opportunities to improve data-driven products and business processes
Support one or more highly complex data-driven business processes, requiring design or integration of data and technology solutions that may cross multiple business organizations
Create artifacts as appropriate, including
business case documentation
scope documentation
process and data flows
impact analysis
data profiling activities to validate requirements and maintain data lineage of the applications
other types of functional, data and technical documentation in support of architectural reviews and development activities
Understand technical and data options, limitations, costs, and risks. Communicate tradeoffs to business partners and work with them to shape requirements accordingly.
Work with stakeholders and developers to develop low and high-fidelity prototypes that illustrate the ‘art of the possible’
Work closely with scrum masters and product owners to groom, refine and manage use cases, requirements and acceptance criteria to ensure alignment to business goals
Ensure requirements are accurate and consistent in all requirement tracking systems
Collaborate with the testing team to ensure user acceptance test plans meet key criteria
Assist with smoke testing and provide validation during the development and deployment
Qualifications
At least 3 years of direct experience in business analysis and requirements management
At least 1 year of direct experience in working with data-driven products, systems and/or business processes
Demonstrated ability to engage both business partners and developers to achieve target outcomes
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
Superb follow-through; propensity to approach tasks and goals with an ownership mentality
Strong interpersonal skills, demonstrating an ability to work well with teams & stakeholders
Excellent communications and organizational skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Proven ability to work in a high demand environment
Pro-active problem-solver willing to help achieve project success
High level understanding of various data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, etc.
High level understanding of various automation technologies like RPA, low code solutions, workflow tools etc.
Agile frameworks knowledge and a working knowledge of Jira a plus

At Amazon, our goal is to be earth’s most customer-centric company and to create a safe environment for both our Customers and our associates. We are looking for a talented business analyst to join the Restricted Products (RP) team.

This role will be a key member of the Science and Analytics team, responsible for driving analysis and insights to help make meaningful business decisions. As a Business Analyst, you will focus on improving the success within business functions by analyzing data, discovering and solving real world problems, building metrics and business cases to improve customer experience, and providing timely data support for escalations to mitigate risk. A key component of the role is to identify process and system improvement opportunities by developing the right metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams. In addition, you will design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Lastly, you will enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.

This role requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities, deep knowledge of business intelligence solutions and outstanding business acumen. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space.

Summary

A successful candidate for the Business Analyst position will be an individual who has demonstrated experience working with business and technology stakeholders to understand and document their requirements for software applications. You work closely with Product Management, Engineering, and QA as a member of an agile squad and provide detailed requirements. You are a self-starter, a strong communicator and are able to quickly establish a trusted relationship with cross-functional team members. You thrive on investigating complicated requirements with unknown dependencies and finding order within chaos.

Responsibilities Include
Working closely with Product Managers to provide detailed feature and capability requirements for the members of an agile development team.
Facilitate and/or attend ad-hoc requirements gathering/clarification meetings
Define acceptance criteria for feature stories
Answer requirements questions in JIRA tickets, Teams, and Slack
Write tickets for non-functional requirement (NFR) stories and bugs with Engineering and Product Management
Update expected results on bugs discovered by QA
Assist the development team in sprint completion by ensuring stories/bugs are in the correct status, facilitate unblocking of any blocked tickets, ensure/facilitate partner team collaboration on feature/epic completion.
Work with Product Management to perform periodic testing throughout the development process and conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) of completed stories.
Document final functionality of new/updated features when epics and features are completed.
Become the point of contact for partners teams with questions about specific areas of ILP, such as the learning tool framework, content development, etc.
Competencies
Understand the Business: Has working knowledge of the overall product capability plan and how it contributes to category plan. Has working knowledge of specific market opportunity or customer needs and expectations into product tool and component design. Consults with other stakeholders to assess options and determine the most efficient and cost-effective approach to building product capabilities.
Efficacy: Has working knowledge of innovation within product capability across categories. Understands from design team efficacy requirements and understands how to embed efficacy capabilities into functional product tools and components.
Collaboration: Is a member of cross-functional product teams with moderate guidance. Provides input to the team on translating customer and technical requirements into well-engineered, tested and deployed product capabilities. Interfaces, with moderate guidance, with stakeholders to determine feasibility for functional capabilities to meet customer expectations and needs.
Digital Change Maker: Has working knowledge on how to build and develop product capabilities with the customer experience in mind, based on inputs on customer intelligence from other stakeholders. Part of the team, with moderate guidance, that investigates new approaches for product build based on examining new technology emerging in the market.
Transformer: Able to identify external or internal obstacles to products delivery or profitability and monitors to ensure that product teams work within parameters of budget.
Education And Work Experience
Bachelor's degree required
Minimum of one to three years of hands on Business Analyst experience in the software industry required
Required Knowledge & Skills
Experience working in an agile software development team and familiarity with agile ceremonies and best practices (writing acceptance criteria, sprint planning, release planning, etc.)
Familiarity with the entire development process, including specification documentation, quality assurance and production support
Solid technical writing skills (requirements, acceptance criteria)
Familiarity with and/or willingness to learn technical concepts of application/product development, REST services, etc.
Excellent communications, interpersonal and teamwork skills
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding attention to detail
Preferred Knowledge & Skills
Experience in education/online learning field
Experience with JIRA

Contribute to decisions regarding proper method of data aggregation and output design

We are looking for an Employee Success Business Intelligence ESBI Analyst to contribute to our Employee Success Strategy Operations ESSO organization to deliver HR reporting and analysis to the business and provide support for ES Compliance. A successful candidate must be able to support high level business analysis requirements by understanding the business need designing an analysis approach and providing an output which can be easily understood and used by the business.

Responsibilities
Tier 3 support for reporting queue cases run ad hoc reports and provide data analysis for all requests received via the employee portal.
Streamline and automate reporting by creating and scheduling canned reports and dashboards in Workday that will aid in better decision making for the business.
Assist in data load file generations for various programs internally within ES or for external teams within the company like ESPP enrollments.

Assist in delivering end- user training and creating user guides on reporting modules.

Research internal and external reporting best practices and methods.
Ensure adherence to corporate data security requirements for the storage transportation and retention of data

Bachelors and/or Masters degree in IT Business Administration or Human Resource Management.
3 years of experience in Workday Reporting analysis and/or information management.
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills with a deep understand of functions vlookup pivot tables graphs and visuals.
Experience with customer support consulting or other customer-facing business role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to be productive with minimal supervision.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management as well as the business and technical communities.
Extremely adept at integrating disparate information correlating data and understanding data trends

Experience with data quality assessment and implementing solutions to improve the data quality.

Results oriented and be able to move forward without complete information.

This position is on the FX Business Analytics team, which is a part of the Foreign Exchange Trading Department located at our New York office. The successful candidate will play a significant role in developing our global FX products, in support of the BBH FX Trading and Sales Desks in New York, London, Tokyo and Hong Kong.

An essential element for success in the FX business is the ability to demonstrate thought leadership and product expertise. This is the ethos of the FX Business Analytics team; whose mission is to develop and implement automated solutions that provide insight into the importance of efficient and transparent FX processes. Thought leadership improves the value proposition of our BBH product offerings, creates brand recognition and ensures stronger ties with our clients as a trusted partner.

Product design, data governance, regulatory compliance, balance sheet management, project testing and implementation, pre- implementation analytics, Client and TCA (Transaction Cost Analysis) reporting and post trade performance attribution are components of the team’s mandate and the successful candidate will play a hand in each.

The analyst will be afforded extensive opportunities to build a solid knowledge of foreign exchange trading and banking IT processes needed to for an effective FX business. Excellent career prospects are afforded according to performance.

Responsibilities
Develop a thorough understanding of the legal and operational framework for FX and regulatory reporting requirements (e.g., Dodd Frank, EMIR, Basel III) for the firm and our clients; implement new or update current processes for regulatory reporting; help manage vendor and trade repository relationships
Design and implement automated FX regulatory, collateral and reporting projects; write business requirements documents and work closely with FX Systems and other diverse teams throughout the firm as necessary to ensure successful implementation
Use Python or similar language as a basic daily tool to extract and compile data for reporting and analysis
Review FX Assets and Liabilities and Risk Weighted Assets daily and use available tools to reduce balance sheet usage
Play a key role in assuring FX data integrity; improve the dynamic mix of referential FX data across our enterprise
Assess and execute internal and external requests for FX data reporting; determine optimal software tools/ methods of automating the collation and presentation of information
Develop a proficiency in using standard FX data sources, e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, as well as have a practical knowledge in using relational and time series databases to extract and tabulate information
Successfully multitask projects within permitted resource and time constraints
Attend client and vendor meetings; assist in formulating solutions to meet client needs
Be consistently alert to current FX industry initiatives and trends that impact BBH
Qualifications
BS degree from an accredited institution, with an Information Technology/Computer or Data Science, Mathematical Economics or Statistics bias
Two to five years with a successful track record with similar responsibilities as described
Solid proficiency in Python (preferred), VBA and/ or SQL
Knowledge of standard quantitative financial tools;
First class organizational, analytical and problem solving capabilities.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
What We Offer
A collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can
Direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world
Opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm
A culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective
High-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind
Rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage
Volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others

The Consumer Talent Programs and Analytics team is looking for a Business Analyst (BA), Promotions to drive the innovation and analytics behind reimagining promotion processes within Field, Corporate and Tech functions. The BA will use data to support promotion process optimization recommendations, evaluate the impact of new or changed promotion processes, and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies and scale. We are looking for a creative, curious thinker with deep analytics experience who is enthusiastic about supporting a highly innovative team operating in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate has an interest in talent management in addition to analytics and wants to use that to help grow talent.

Key job responsibilities

Major Responsibilities Include

Obsess over the voice of employees, HR, and business leaders to ensure their perspectives are at the forefront of science and process development and implementation

Collaborate with the promotions program team to translate business needs into requirements for data objects including metrics, attributes, reports, and dashboards

Design a data metric library for common metric definitions and reporting requirements

Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption using visualization tools like Quicksight or Tableau

Extract, analyze and model relevant data from operations and HR

Identify opportunities to automate and streamline promotion processes

Develop new techniques to process large data sets, address quantitative problems, and recommend white spaces for experimentation

Partner with research science and analytics teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.

Dedication to problem-solving to deliver innovative solutions to core business problems and employee needs

Draft concise documents communicating results to stakeholders, visualizing data where beneficial to drive decision-making

Job Description

Columbia Threadneedle Investments is a leading and evolving global asset management company. The Trading Business Support Team is responsible for all business, operational and technical support for the global trading platform that supports Columbia Threadneedle Investments’ entire product offering with trading across all asset classes including equity, fixed income, derivatives and FX instruments. Within the Trading Business Support Team the Business Analyst role, working with other members of the team, will provide business, operating and technical support to the global trading platform across all asset classes (i.e., equity, fixed income, derivatives and FX). This position requires an energetic person who is looking for an opportunity to develop expertise in trading and the asset management business in general.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Collaborating with traders and business partners to develop and implement trading policies, procedures and workflows that meet compliance and regulatory requirements from both a global and regional perspective
Serve as a key business support resource for traders across the global, as well as other front office personnel, on trading related matters with a focus on risk and operational controls
Liaise with business partners to support on-going trading operations, including pro-actively addressing internal and external changes that affect the business
Working with both internal business partners and external vendors, support trading related technology needs including:
Management of current operating systems
Implementation of system enhancements and upgrades to existing applications
Deployment of new applications
Support trading related reporting requirements including:
Internal reporting for senior management and Fund Boards
Trade cost analysis
General trade related reporting
Support the governance structure and internal committees that oversee trading activities
Management of small to medium size projects requiring developing efficient, long-term solutions to meet changes in the operating environment
Support the management of vendor services for the trading platform

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
1-3 years of relevant experience
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to produce effective recommendations
Strong critical thinking skills
Energetic and self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Strong interpersonal and communication skills that provide the ability to build effective relationships
Ability to analyze data with attention to detail and draw meaningful insights
Ability to interrelate and understand issues across multiple disciplines
Ability to manage multiple responsibilities concurrently

About Our Company

Millions of people around the world rely on Columbia Threadneedle Investments to manage their money. We're intentionally built to help our clients succeed, backed by a global team of 2,000 people including more than 450 investment professionals sharing global perspectives across all major asset classes and markets. At Columbia Threadneedle, you’ll find the promise we make to our clients is the same one we make to our employees: Your success is our priority. In addition to our competitive total rewards package, employees stay with us because of our culture and commitment to their development. And, backed by the strength of our parent company, Ameriprise Financial, we are committed to providing you with the tools, resources, recognition and rewards to help you shape the career you want.

Ameriprise Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, gender identity, disability, veteran status, marital status, family status or any other basis prohibited by law.

position: Business Analyst, Trustworthy Shopping Experience LATAM , Trustworthy Shopping Experience
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Customer Trust & Partner Support (CTPS) is responsible for creating a trustworthy shopping experience across Amazon stores worldwide by protecting customers, brands, selling partners and Amazon from fraud, counterfeit, and abuse as well as empowering, providing world‐class support, and building loyalty with Amazon’s millions of selling partners. We value individual expression, respect different opinions, and work together to create a culture where each of us is able to contribute fully. Our unique backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our ability to achieve Amazon's mission of being Earth's most customer-centric company.

Amazon's Trustworthy Shopping Experience (TSE) team works to ensure that buyers receive authentic products. We design and implement policies, tools and technology innovations to protect the buying experience on Amazon while minimizing friction for sellers.

For our Latin America (LATAM) TSE Regional team we are looking for a Business Analyst with a passion for using data to discover and solve real world problems. You will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights drive the creation of real tools and features for our customers and thousands of merchants participating in our Marketplace on a regular basis.

The perfect candidate will have passion and experience analyzing data and using that analysis to drive key insights and recommendations. As a business analyst you will also build reports and metrics, drive ad hoc analysis and communicate insights to key stakeholders. You will not only execute on the required skills but also be able to influence, educate, and drive results in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.

You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of policies, processes and tools to address product quality challenges in collaboration with teams across Amazon. This is an opportunity that requires a critical thinker with strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills. At the core of the position is passion for protecting Amazon’s reputation and the customer experience and trust.

Key job responsibilities
Build and maintain recurring metrics and reports.
Complete ad hoc data retrieval and analysis using relational databases, Excel and other data management systems.
Design and implement reporting solutions enabling stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions.
Monitor existing metrics as well as develop and propose new metrics, working across the Product Quality organization to make actionable intelligence available to business stakeholders.
Support cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of projects and initiatives.
Help develop requirements and specifications with business and development teams
Communicate insights to key stakeholders
Dive deep to solve unstructured/ambiguous problems including discovering unknown issues that can influence the product and policy road map

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required (majors in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field preferred)
2+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Advanced Proficiency in SQL and Excel (including VBA, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.)
Advanced working knowledge of data mining using, ETL, data warehouse
Proven analytical problem solving skills in a complex space
Self-driven, ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Willingness to roll up the sleeves and do what is necessary to meet team goals
Preferred Qualifications
Experience visualizing data for customers using Tableau and/or other data visualization tools
Working knowledge of statistical methodologies
Experience using AWS analytical services (e.g., Redshift, Data Pipeline, EMR, Machine Learning, Kinesis)

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1890379

You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Recon Department is a global support service utilizing a data driven business strategy to proactively identify and solve data integrity problems across all systems.

The Recon Department’s primary purpose and responsibility is to determine why data in different systems is incorrect usually one of four categories is where we start the process;
System - software is not operating as intended.
Process - the work process being followed when manually updating data is incorrect or incomplete.
People - the work process is correct but isn’t being followed.
Reporting - System is functioning accurately, but data being reported is inaccurate.
Once the root cause is determined, you work with other areas and departments to ensure that existing errors are corrected, but also to prevent them from happening in the future. Root Cause Analysis is the act of proactively identifying the underlying causes of variances.

Position Purpose

Perform various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function
Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of new systems
Identify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes
Perform detailed analysis on assigned projects, recommend potential business solutions and assist with implementation
Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 0-2 years of business process analysis or data analysis experience. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access preferred. Project management experience preferred.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility
Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development
Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

About Us

Staffigo is in the business of providing IT Consulting Services to clients in various industries in the United States - Healthcare (Payer, Providers & Clearinghouses), Finance & Banking, Retail & eCommerce . We are currently seeking exceptional entry-level talent for the below role.

Job Description
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Performing requirements analysis.
Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff.
Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Managing competing resources and priorities.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.

Minimum Requirements
Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or any related field of study
No travel; no telecommuting. Job duties are project-based and performed on long-term assignments at various unanticipated sites within the U.S. which may require relocation at the end of each project.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Understanding of software development life cycle.

position: Business Analyst, Amazon Fresh, Grocery Private Brands
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you want to be part of the Amazon Grocery history? Do you want to be in the intersection of innovation with our Omni-channel expansion, Private Brands, and Just Walk Out technology? Do you like start-up builder orgs and drive scale? Then this is the place for you!

This role can be based in Seattle WA, NYC, Los Angeles CA, Arlington VA, Nashville TN, Austin TX.

The Team

Amazon Fresh Private Brands is more start-up than big-company, a group of entrepreneurial, analytical, and creative leaders with innovation at our core. We’re pushing the state of the art in helping customers shop in engaging, fast, and safe ways.

The Role

We are looking for a Business Analyst to support the Grocery Private Brands product team within the Innovation, Strategy, and Scale Team. You will work cross-functionally with product managers, BIEs, supply chain, marketing and quality teams to develop and deliver best in class private brand grocery products.

Key job responsibilities

Identify, develop, and execute data analysis to uncover areas of business opportunity

Design and execute analyses, including data mining by utilizing available analysis tools, interpret the results and develop recommendations and actionable steps based on the learning

Shape and inform key metrics and indicators by which we will assess product category and vendor performance

Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when and which data sources to use

Deep dive into data sets to answer key business questions using SQL and Excel

A day in the life

Integrate with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Supply Chain, Quality and Marketing managers) to understand and execute against data needs

Define and develop new metrics and measurement methodologies to best report on our fast-growing business

Develop reporting, create documentation and train the team to enable users the self-service data needs

Partner closely with BIEs to develop requirements for creating new data pipelines and automating reporting

Provide high-quality, timely reporting for executive level reviews

About The Team

The Grocery Private Brands team develops high quality and great value brands such as Fresh and highly differentiated products such as Aplenty. Our team serves both Amazon's Fresh grocery stores, which feature cutting-edge technologies such as the Dash Cart and Just Walk Out, and Amazon Fresh delivery which has presence nationwide in key major cities. Our role is to develop the Grocery Private Brands for Fresh stores and Fresh Delivery. We are in our early days of the business and there is no playbook! We are seeking individuals that have a start-up mentality to enable the team to scale, connect the dots, look around corners, and continuously search for data-driven solutions to improve the product.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
3+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis
Experience in SQL

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in food, grocery, or logistics

Ability to navigate through ambiguity and build models based on ‘what if’ scenarios

Ability to handle changing priorities

Advanced skills in statistical & data analysis

Experience creating executive level reporting

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2014240

Description:
LOCATION: RTP/HYBRID (2 DAYS IN OFFICE)
Biogen is pursuing a Business Analyst to work with the US Data & Analytics team. The ideal candidate has a strong desire for excellence, has strong documentation skills, and can work independently. The BA will be responsible for reviewing current data & analytics projects/activities and documenting them as processes for CI and optimization. They will be able to connect with the SMEs across project teams, analyze current environment, work with the team to establish and map processes for business understanding, and work to link the data flows to the processes. This position is a remote position.
JOB DUTIES (What are the day-to-day responsibilities for this position?)
Determines operational objectives bystudying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
Designsnew processes by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Research software systems in order to understand existing functionalities and impact of potential changes
Documents scope of software update requests through research
Captures business requirements and business process management
Translates business requirements to specific and complete functional requirements to be relied upon by designated project team
Collaborates with the project team and validate that all necessary requirements have been fulfilled
Various marginal functions
REQUIRED SKILLS (i.e., years of experience, education, etc.)
Education: BS degree in computer science, information technology, or related field, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Minimum Experience:
1- 2 years of business systems analysis experience including working with customers and project teams to launch successful projects that meet the requirements of the business
At least (5) years of pharmaceutical industry experience.
Or equivalent combination of education and/or experienceADDITONAL EXPECTATIONS (preferred or desired skills)
Problem-solving: Strongly developed problem-solving skills are crucial in this role.
Communication: Analysts are required to communicate with team members of all levels, both written and
verbal communication to gather information about a business and create reports.
Technical: Upgrading, troubleshooting, and implementing new hardware programs.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a talented Business Analyst based at HQ2 in Arlington, Virginia to help develop and execute Amazon’s external counterfeit enforcement efforts. You will work with a team of attorneys, investigators and risk managers to identify counterfeiters and other bad actors around the world, develop and pursue cases against them, and work with law enforcement to disrupt their activities.

This role will partner closely with Amazon’s Customer Trust and Partner Support team and other stakeholders to develop targeting criteria for bad actors and build civil and criminal cases against them. Strong or proficient SQL abilities are a must, as this role will be responsible for the effective extraction and analysis of complex internal data, as well as creating and maintaining new tables to ingest and analyze external data.

A successful individual should be highly collaborative and organized. You should be able to prioritize multiple deliverables and effectively communicate progress and blockers. You should feel comfortable working across multiple data sources, be creative in seeking new inputs, and be capable of participating in and understanding how multiple systems communicate information to each another. At the same time, you need to be an effective communicator able to translate complex technology and data to lawyers and law enforcement.

Successful candidates must be mission-oriented and able to pursue projects to completion with a minimum of input or direction, take initiative in creating and improving work processes, and work effectively on a variety of simultaneously active matters in a fast-paced environment.

Amazon is constantly innovating and working with rights owners and law enforcement to ensure a trusted customer experience in our stores. We are looking for someone with strong judgment who can think big about these efforts while delivering results to deter and prevent bad actors from attempting to sell inauthentic goods.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Computer Science, MIS, Math, Statistics, Business, Finance, etc.) or relevant work experience
2+ years of experience in a business analyst, data analyst, statistical analysis role or related field working with large data sets and writing complex SQL queries for investigative purposes
Proficient in developing business requirements and formulating metrics to support reporting, dashboards and effective data visualizations
Able to source, work with, and combine disparate data sets to answer business questions
Strong communication skills in order to communicate investigative results to external audiences, particularly legal and law enforcement audiences
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of legal concepts related to evidentiary standards and civil and criminal procedure

position: Business Analyst - Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas, Alpharetta, Cleveland 1
details:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Location:

As part of our Americas Tax Technology Group (ATTG) you will be part of a technology organization that develops and maintains innovative solutions for our client-serving Tax professionals. ATTG professionals will partner with our Tax professionals to develop supporting technology such as digital/mobile tools to improve internal operations, application of Robotics Process Automation (RPA) to collect financial data, development of advanced financial dashboards, visualization, analytics, and reports. The Business Analyst role sits in the Solutions Delivery Pillar.

Essential Functions of the Job:
Responsible for partnering with Business Technology Leaders, Solution Delivery Leaders and Architects in the definition and delivery of long-term business and technology strategies for one or more portfolio(s) through the application of domain knowledge and enterprise analysis; fostering reuse and continuity throughout.
Plan and manage the BA approach; communicating, driving and managing the business analysis effort for the Portfolio throughout all phases of the ATTG project life cycle.
Lead a team of BAs assigned to assigned program/portfolio project(s), ensuring comprehensive business analysis is performed on all projects across the assigned Portfolio/Programs. Also will perform hands-on BA work directly as needed.
Actively review requirements traceability for impact and coverage analysis throughout the Portfolio.
Work with the Analysis Community of Practice to ensure consistent application of the Solutions Delivery and ATTG standards and methodologies and advise on exceptions.

Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:
Ability to clearly articulate both problems and proposed solutions
Proactive approach to identifying issues and presenting solutions and options, and where appropriate, leading to resolution
Ability to prioritize personal and team workloads to best meet organizational objectives

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working effectively and building relationships with and between teams, external vendors and internal clients at varying executive levels
Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change based on client needs
TAX or Finance domain knowledge
Experience leading other BAs to provide analysis and requirements, ensure consistency, accuracy and quality of BA deliverables on larger initiatives
Experience with Enterprise Analysis.
Expert on industry-standard, structured business analysis techniques (i.e., user stories, use cases, UML/logical modeling, BABOK, etc.) appropriately modifying according to the decided software development methodology (i.e., Agile, Iterative, SCRUM, RUP, Waterfall, etc.) in use. Experience with Agile desired.
Experience using, training and driving others to use requirements management, modeling, and change control software(s)

Supervision Responsibilities:
Provide supervision and direction to team members and staff
Delegate, coach, coordinate and lead co-workers and project team members
Responsible for assigning work and reviewing performance, requiring leadership of virtual teams

Other Requirements:
Occasional overnight travel may be required

Job Requirements:
A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience.
Master's degree preferred
10-12 years of relevant experience
Management experience a plus
CBAP or CBATL certification preferred.

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

What We Offer

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Come build the future with us! What unites all Amazonians (across teams and geographies) is that we are all striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier—whoever that customer may be. In pursuit of delighting customers, Amazonians have developed many products and services that have transformed the way our customers live their lives and run their businesses. Together we are building the future, one innovative product, service, and idea at a time.

The Sizmek Ad Suite provides advertisers and agencies with solutions to create, distribute, measure, and optimize their messaging. These solutions include ad serving, creative authoring, analytics, and dynamic creative optimization solutions. We help advertisers to get the most out of their campaigns. Customers can run efficient and effective advertising campaigns both on Amazon properties as well as on third-party sites and apps through our direct publisher relationships and third-party exchanges. Customers are able to gain a holistic view of advertising campaign performance, to measure the effectiveness of all campaigns across Amazon Advertising solutions and other media properties. With this visibility into what is happening with campaigns and brands, customers can further optimize media buying strategies.

We are seeking a seasoned business intelligence analyst to join the ranks as part of the global customer operations team to help us build analytics solutions by connecting multiple sources of data from internal systems and advertising data to compile results into a meaningful story. The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of customer obsession. As a BIA, you will own the data platform for the entire Sizmek customer operations org. Your analysis and data tools will guide our reporting, benchmarking, program optimization and execution strategy. You will also help us define our analytics deliverables for our customer engagements, helping us drive the story of our customer’s use of our technology.

Key job responsibilities
Analyze large sets of data, establish benchmarks, and give actionable insights and forward-thinking recommendations.
Identify data trends and provide insight on what is driving the changes by asking questions from the data.
Merge data (potentially writing scripts for joining tables), build dashboards, and act as a QuickSight expert.
Coordinate with leadership to create metrics to model variable headcount utilization and give insight on staffing demands.
Redefine and simplify existing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to support the team’s analytical and business needs.
Serve as liaison with upstream data teams across finance, ads analytics and product teams.
Source data and build infrastructure that enables the teams to make data driven business decisions.
Identify opportunities to automate systems and tools; improve upon existing approaches by adding data sources, optimizing methodology, and testing model structures.
Identify data inconsistencies and or anomalies and work with the data integrity and audit teams to build mechanisms to address.
Develop scalable dashboards to arm Customer Success and Business Development teams with insights on a customer’s business for business reviews.
About The Team

Sizmek Ad Suite Global Operations is an organization comprised of several teams working to ensure our ad serving and creative customers are successful in using our technology - Sizmek Ad Suite and Sizmek Ad Builder. Our deep product knowledge and customer obsession enables us to provide customers with optimal customer service and support.


Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
3+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Experience with Microsoft Excel
Experience in SQL
Experience in the advertising industry.
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel and analytical platforms.
Proven experience in writing SQL queries and the use of data visualization tools, e.g. QuickSight.
Experience in developing requirements, formulating business metrics for reporting, and displaying complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format.
Ability to distill informal customer requirements into problem definitions, dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives.
Proven program management skills to coordinate projects across cross-functional teams, including business intelligence, engineering, operations, product management, and finance.
Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Excellent verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Excellent customer service skills, including strong ability to determine customer needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Familiarity with Salesforce.com.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Are you excited about the cloud computing industry and leveraging cutting edge data analytics technologies and methodologies? Are you interested in driving business decisions through data analysis, reporting, and KPIs? Do you want to work on a team of Business Analysts, Business Intelligence Engineers, and Data Engineers to solve AWS’s most complex business problems through data?

AWS WW Specialized Organization, Strategy & Operations team, Solutions & Program Group is seeking a passionate, results-oriented Business Analyst to own defining, building, and scaling metrics and analytical insights that will measure the success and drive the day-to-day behavior of the business. In this role, you will work closely with members of various Go To Market teams to ensure we are capturing and surfacing data, and providing insights, to make optimal business decisions. You’ll collaborate with engineers to build self-service reports and establish automated processes for large-scale data analyses. Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen, and detail-oriented with excellent problem solving skills.

To be successful in this role, the candidate will have worked in data analysis, including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL, leveraging Excel features for data analysis, and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information using visualization tools. The candidate should also have communication and project management skills, enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. They should also have a demonstrated ability to think analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to work across a diverse, cross-functional team. Candidates should possess a keen sense of ownership, scrappiness, and desire to learn.

Location: U.S. city with AWS corporate office.

About The Team

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications
2+ years of experience in data analysis
1+ years experience using SQL
Experience in Excel
Experience with at least one data visualization tool (Power BI, Tableau, QuickSight, or similar)
Bachelor’s degree
Preferred Qualifications
Proven quantitative skills and an ability to use data to back up assumptions and develop business cases
Advanced proficiency in SQL, ETL, data modeling, and working with “Big Data”
Computer programming experience in Python, R, Ruby, or Java
Experience using AWS analytical services (e.g., Redshift, Data Pipeline, EMR, Machine Learning, Kinesis)
Experience solving complex problems
Excited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and data analysis

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction record.

A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site.
