Position: Business Analyst 2(Service Parts Business Analyst) | 7635-1

Location: 12 months contract

Duration: 12+months (Possibility for extension)

Position Summary

Making the future is everyday life at Client. We’re seeking innovators who are called to not just change the world but build a better one. We enable the best technology hardware on the planet, but our best is always a prototype for something better and our people thrive with a driven mindset – better builds on better. We believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.

Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Utilize return forecast and usage rate to plan materials through the Materials Requirements Planning (MRP) System. (40%)
Plan and maintain in-box accessory parts for NCP process (40%)
Review day to day NCP ticket trend and resolve any unprocessed tickets to support customer demand. (40%)
Plan and maintain MRP for New Product Introductions and plan end-of-life cycle forecasts (40%)
Maintain master materials data and bill of materials to plan and execute MRP accurately. (40%)
Manage Client Electronics Canada service parts back order and support with current client resource to maintain low back order ratio (40%)
Analyze inventory levels based upon parts usage, lead-time to delivery and current balance on-hand and future demands. Utilize existing tracking and reporting systems to track and monitor all service parts activity. Monitors parts usage to determine need for changes to inventory levels, order quantity. Develop and maintain new reports in Business Warehouse and SAP as necessary. (40%)
Interfaces with vendors and customers on a daily basis to ensure parts orders are fulfilled in an accurate and timely manner. Ensures that all interested parties are kept abreast of service parts information, parts availability, order status, shipments, tracking shipment deliveries, stock levels, etc. that affect product service repairs. (30%)
Develop and Create reports on key performance metrics on a daily/weekly/monthly basis (20%)
Ensure NCP Process vendor properly manages all pending ticket in timely manner (10%)
Prepares and create service parts Purchase Orders. Tracks orders and shipping status. Modifies and maintains entries. Monitors and analyzes service parts inventories against open parts purchase orders within the SAP system. (10%)
Researches, resolves and takes action to correct errors, changes in parts inventory levels, part specifications, part functional failures, abnormalities, etc. as required. (10%)
Participates in client ’s engineering and product change process in support of customer orders, order backlog, product inventory and installed base and recommends appropriate actions to ensure that all activities are rolled into the production and shipping plans as required. (10%)
As required, coordinates the return, repair and disposition of materials at STA and SEC. Monitors the aging of these RMA’s to ensure expeditious return of materials to the customer. (10%)
Background/Experience
Associates Degree in accounting, industrial or business management or similar course of study from a college or university, or equivalent work experience. APICS certification in Materials Resource Planning is desirable.
Should have a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in inventory control, production planning, scheduling, hi-tech products or parts purchasing, repair parts expediting and shipping in support of manufacturing or assembly operations.
Demonstrated abilities in telecommunications or office products parts resourcing, planning, researching and ordering utilizing a SAP or similar business enterprise system for purchasing and inventory control.
Read write and verbal communications skills to prepare and present plans and information to product repair, vendors and purchasing management personnel.
Experience using Microsoft PC software including extensive use of Excel spreadsheets, Word, Access.
Experience with SAP or similar business systems and/or sales order management software applications
Top 3 must-have skills/requirements? Advanced Excel, Supply chain background, Analyze and report Forecast, inventory management processes

Education? Associates Degree

How many years of experience is required? 2-3 years’ experience

Must Have
Advanced Excel – experienced data analytical skills
Supply chain background
Familiar with forecasting, demand planning, purchasing and inventory management processes
Analyze and report Forecast/MRP fluctuations, catch system error or planning issues
Specific shortage mitigation: prioritize and allocate across plants, track critical transportation, etc.
Strategic supply chain management: Creative ideas to improve process or utilize new tools
Familiar with SAP (mainly material planning module): T-codes, query, report
Good communication skills – will need to work with multiple teams such as Sourcing, IT, supply chain planning, purchasing and material, logistics, engineering, etc.

Posted by
Vineet Wadhwa
Director, Talent Acquisition | Covanta - a world leader in sustainable waste and energy solutions

Join us in creating a sustainable future and becoming a protector of tomorrow!

The Business Analyst works with business relationship managers, PMO team members, business stakeholders, technology teams, and related third parties; to discover, illustrate and communicate requirements. The candidate must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. As a core function of this role, the BA will be engaging directly with business stakeholders and needs to be technically savvy to interact with the technical support staff. The BA needs to be an independent worker, a self-starter and able to manage multiple priorities while adapting to a fluid set of business requirements. Formal project management experience or a PM certification is preferred, but not required for this role.

A standard 40-hour workweek is associated with this role. At times, the workweek may exceed 40 hours. Business travel is estimated at 10%.

Key Responsibilities, Deliverables, And Expectations
Identify and document end-user requirements, business requirements and stakeholder classes.
Define project scope and identify IT resource requirements.
Meet with stakeholders and IT application owners to elicit detailed requirements through interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, and site visits.
Develop business process descriptions, use cases, workflows, and models.
Perform in-depth business process task and workflow analysis, identifying detailed business rules for application processing logic.
Analyze the information elicited, resolving conflicts, documenting assumptions, constraints, and dependencies, and working with the stakeholders to establish priorities.
Specify the business needs using a combination of graphical models and textual documents.
Review the represented information with the stakeholders for quality characteristics such as completeness, correctness, and feasibility.
Engage with Solution Architects to evaluate the impact of system changes on downstream work processes and organizational impacts.
Create system design proposals, models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to technical staff.
Work closely with the Application/System Architects and Project Delivery Team, perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
Support the Project Request/Approval Governance process.
Conduct requirement walk-throughs for the development team.
Monitor the progress of development and implementation.
Documenting current state business processes
Assists with business case preparation.
Assist in the development and execution of test cases.
Produce traceability matrix, status reports.
Provide oversight for Quality Assurance testing.
Draft, publish and distribute communication of the enhancements to end-users.
Manage the project intake portfolio and high-level schedules.
Complete required training in order to become familiar with the current system.
Position Requirements
Excellent mathematical and creative problem-solving skills.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate those business needs into application and operational requirements.
Comfortable to work independently with users to define concepts and under the direction of business relationship managers and project managers.
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and business language.
Self-motivated and directed with good time-management skills.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment with strong customer service orientation.
Knowledge and experience with all aspects of requirements engineering, including commonly used tools.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and tools is a plus.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in the field of Business Administration, Computer Science, Accounting, or Information Technology systems is required.
Experience
5+ years of work experience in an IT Business Analyst role
Experience with NetSuite preferred
Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.)
Microsoft Visio

Description

Are you a proficient problem-solver who is adept at creating action plans based on business needs? The Business Analyst will be responsible for the documentation, analysis, and elicitation of business and technical needs across multiple business units. Exceptional communication skills and a proven ability to communicate technical and business requirements alike are keys to success for this Business Analyst role!

What you get to do every single day
Builds relationships and collaborates with business units, development teams, and other stakeholders to gather, analyze and prioritize requests
Documents and elicits requirements through user stories, use cases, process flow diagrams, etc.
Ensures that complex requirements are executable, testable, complete and not ambiguous
Requirements
Experience eliciting and documenting requirements in a clear and concise manner
4+ years of business analysis experience
Ability to write basic to moderately complex SQL queries, as well as technical skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Jira (or similar tool)
Background working with a variety of simple to complex projects
Willing to take ownership, proactive, flexible, adaptable, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate to all levels in an organization
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent work experience
Comfortable with Agile methodology

You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose

Perform and lead various analysis and interpretation to link business needs and objectives for assigned function and implement process improvements.
Lead the support of business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of various systems
Lead the identification and analysis of user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes
Resolve issues and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvement
Perform detailed analysis on multiple projects, recommend potential business solutions and ensure successful implementations, including improvements and revisions to business processes and requirements
Evaluate risks and concerns and communicate to management
Coordinate with various business units and departments in the development and delivery of training programs
Develop, share, and incorporate organizational best practices into business applications
Oversee all changes to departmental policies and procedures, including communicating and implementing the changes
Serve as the subject matter expert on the assigned function product to ensure operational performance
Ability to travel
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility
Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development
Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. 6+ years of business process or data analysis preferably in healthcare or 5+ years of HEDIS analysis. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel and Access preferred. Project management experience preferred.

NoteApplicants for this job have the flexibility to work remote

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

My client is searching for a business-focused technology consultant and functional subject matter expert to assist with advancing the technology capabilities of the Middle Office and Controllers businesses. The individual will work closely with the Middle Office, as well as, key stakeholders in Fund Finance and Front Office to lead projects, gather and document business requirements and coordinate the development, testing, implementation and ongoing support of these requirements.

They are looking for a Business Analyst

Candidate Requirements
10+ years industry full-cycle experience of SDLC methodologies and approaches, including refining business requirements and defining functional specifications
Leadership skills, including experience leading complex projects including multiple parties both internal and external
Past experience contributing to the development of a business vision and managing complex project management through the design and implementation of projects
Excellent conceptualization, analytical, and logic skills enabling comprehension and development of complex technical and business issues, topics, and plans
Excellent communications skills, with the ability to communicate and work with various levels of sponsors
Knowledge of and experience with credit and derivative instruments (Bank Loans, Bonds, Derivatives, etc.) are a must
Experience with SQL is a must and development experience is preferred
Experience with the IVP and VPM fund accounting platform is preferred
Must be self-directed and motivated while being a solid team player with a strong work ethic
Technical experience with application infrastructure, including servers, DB, networking
Experience working with data warehouses and business intelligence platforms is nice to have
Ability to thrive in a high-intensity faced paced environment

Contract until end of this year with extensions. Multiple spots Our client in Philadelphia, PA is looking for a SAFe Agile Business Analyst to join their team. This is a contract role. This is an opportunity to join a busy team with a leading healthcare company. Position Description Providing analysis for product managers and architects (analyzing what the system is doing and where data comes from) Coordinating integration points from different systems and teams Capturing requirements in confluence page Writing requirements in a business format Commercial and Medicare focused work (Medicaid work by end of the year) Required Skills 5+ years Experience working as Technical BA Creating and mapping documents Solution diagram orchestration diagram Strong documentation skills Experience writing requirements Health insurance background (technical side needed. business side of health insurance not helpful) SAFeAgile experience Ability to research, understand, and document requirements related to file feeds, APIs, and services Detail orientedability to ask questionsforward thinking Bonus Skills Experience with Rally (features and stories to understand requirements from PMs) Experience using Confluence (the group is creating a requirements page) Pharmacybenefitsaccumulators experience

Job Description:

THE OPPORTUNITY

The Business Analyst (BA) Intern serves at the intersection of the Business / Product Stakeholders and Engineering teams. In this role, you will be working on critical projects to support our businesses, helping to translate requirements into user stories for technical development. The BA intern will help ensure that the needs of the business and customers are being met by testing new development features and assessing the impact of those features. The ideal candidate for this role requires strong communication skills, the ability to manage project scope and deadlines, and a commitment to delivering the highest quality in all projects. Being analytically minded, detail oriented, and passionate about making a difference is a must for this role.

Responsibilities

Proactively seeks to understand each division’s business objectives and how they fit into the overall business and technical strategy
Understands how the business objectives intersect with technology and helps translate those objectives into functional requirements
Serves as a contributing member of agile scrum teams, helping to build exciting new software and technical capabilities
Analyzes and understands requirements following software development lifecycle methodologies
Facilitate technology discussions between engineering teams and business stakeholders regarding schedule and priority
Partner with the engineering teams to develop, quantify, and track technical KPIs to measure improvement
Supports the product owner or product managers in the businesses by helping to manage the backlog of requirements in the form of user stories
Builds domain expertise by learning core fundamental business analysts skills and processes
Facilitates the implementation of operational and business requirements
Communicates how requirements fit into milestones and software releases as part of managing a larger roadmap
Monitors post-production processes to ensure accurate completion of all deployments
Apprises supervisor of status, schedule variances and outstanding issues

Who We Are

Scholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of print and digital instructional materials for pre-K to grade 12, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs, classroom magazines and other products that, in combination, offer schools customized solutions to support children's learning both at school and at home. The Company also makes quality, affordable books available to all children through school-based book clubs and book fairs. With a 100+ year history of service to schools and families, Scholastic continues to carry out its commitment to "Open a World of Possible" for all children. Learn more at Scholastic.com/AboutScholastic.

About The Associate Program

Scholastic’s Technology Associate Program is designed to identify, train, and promote the next generation of leaders. Each new-hire class receives comprehensive training and is quickly given responsibility to deliver on business goals using industry-leading tools, partners, and technology – all while working in an agile, iterative model that emphasizes collaboration, transparency, and goal-oriented development.

Qualifications

HOW YOU CAN FIT (Qualifications)

Summary

In this role, you will apply analytical thinking and problem-solving skills to develop user stories and the product backlog for one primary product. You will participate in Agile ceremonies and provides clarification on product requirements.

Responsibilities
Work as a liaison between end-users, product management, and development to elicit, analyze, and document user requirements, translating them into user stories.
Collaborate with the Product Owner to ensure the health of the product backlog.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, driving the discussion during sprint planning and user story refinement.
Plan and conduct interviews with business owners and stakeholders.
Conduct gap analyses to identify solutions that are cost-effective and meet business requirements.
Collaborate with the development team to ensure the design meets customer requirements.
Support the project team during design, development, and QA testing by clarifying requirements questions.
Create SQL statements and analyze resultant data.
Act as a point of contact during UAT to assist stakeholders/end users when issues/questions arise.

Comply with metrics to measure the progress of group or department issues.
Provide reasonable estimates for work products.

2 years or more years’ experience in SDLC business analysis required.
Knowledge of Business Process analysis and diagramming.
Agile (Scrum or XP) business analysis experience with user stories and backlogs required.
Excellent business requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation skills.
Knowledge of Data Analytics/Data Warehousing/Big Data concepts.
Ability to understand complex business areas and applications.
Knowledge of test methodologies.
Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The AWS Localization team makes AWS resources accessible in many languages and cultures, expanding every year. We are much more than translators, we are also builders of solutions, platforms, and tools that innovate and automate complex localization processes. We are passionate about delivering the best customer experience based upon insights, reporting, and measurements.

We are looking for a highly analytical and collaborative person with enterprise level experience to help unlock insights and take our business to the next level. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as outstanding business acumen. The ideal candidate will work back from the customer to create actionable insights and reporting. They are experts in partnering and earning trust with stakeholders to drive these key business decisions. You will leverage data to drive operational efficiencies, provide key data-driven insights, enable new opportunities and innovate on behalf of business customers.

Key job responsibilities
Design and own the development and maintenance of metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc...
Partner with stakeholder teams to develop and implement KPIs, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements
Prepare and deliver business requirements reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks
Enable decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Design and influence operational best practices for reporting and analytics to enable the team to scale as we grow presence in new and existing territories
Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs
Excellent writing skills, to create artifacts that provide the information needed by business and tech partners
About The Team

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future


Basic Qualifications
5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role
Intermediate SQL, ETL, Excel and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Advanced ability to draw insights from analysis supported by data and concisely communicate them
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced technical or business degree (MS or MBA)
Experience in the Localization industry, or with global customers
Ability to convert business requirements into actionable activities
Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
Creative data management and presentation

details:

The successful candidate will be creating and writing SQL queries as the primary role in this position with about 70 of time being spent working directly with SQL. We are looking for an energetic and resourceful hands-on individual that has strong interpersonal skills and goes above and beyond to deliver outstanding work. The Senior Business Analyst well lead the planning and implementation of both technical and business projects from cradle to grave. We are looking for a strong self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced smaller environment with the ability to prioritize and multitask as needed. Right now, we are working 3 to 4 days in the office and 1 to 2 days remotely so please plan to be on site predominantly although we recognize this could change. Apply now for immediate consideration.

Schneider Electric has an opportunity for a Business Analyst in any of our Hub locations (Nashville, TN, Dallas, TX, Boston MA, Chicago IL, Louisville, KY) or remotely.

Schneider Electric’s Sustainability business has developed a solution for Capital Asset Planning (CAP) that is experiencing tremendous growth and success. The Capital Asset Planning solution provides customers with a comprehensive view of their entire facility portfolio plus expert advice to optimize their operations. Due to the success and growth of the CAP solution, we are currently seeking a talented Technical Product Owner / Business Analyst to provide technical product leadership. In this role you will shape the product vision, understand customer needs, define, and influence objectives, articulate success, and turn the vision into a reality.

A successful candidate enjoys tackling new challenges, thinks strategically, executes methodically and proactively problem solves to successfully deliver results in a dynamic business environment.

Schneider Electric creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 135,000+ employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment.

Great People Make Schneider Electric a Great Company.

Partner with business subject matter experts to define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for capabilities.

Manage and implement application configurations and administrative setup configurations in the application as required.

Responsible for ensuring application environments are accessible to our partners to execute software improvements and coordinate schedules for backups with the Technology team as required.
Actively manage 3rd party vendor relationships
Other related duties as needed to ensure product success.
On September 9, 2021, U.S. Executive Order 14042 was issued, requiring all who are working in connection with federal contracts to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or have a company-approved medical or religious exemption. Since the Order was issued, the District Court of Georgia has placed a legal hold on the Mandate’s vaccine requirements in all states nationwide. As such, the vaccine requirements of the Mandate and the Policy are currently on HOLD for U.S. employees, partners, and vendors. If the legal hold is overturned, we will resume the process to comply with the Mandate and Policy and all Schneider Electric U.S.-based employees will be required to show proof of vaccination or have a company-approved medical or religious exemption. We will continue to monitor and comply with the legal decisions regarding the Mandate and adjust our Policy accordingly. Independent of the legal hold, we will continue to comply with customer vaccination requirements.

Experience with Product Roadmap development and influencing key stakeholders for buy-in on business priorities

OVERVIEW
BioHealth Innovation, Inc. (BHI), is a Montgomery County innovation intermediary which translates market-relevant research into commercial success by bringing together management, funding, and markets. BHI is seeking a life science business analyst to support the NIH SEED Office (https://seed.nih.gov/). The analyst will provide business landscape analysis and other project support on product development, corporate strategy, and private investment for NIH-funded companies. This will entail market landscape, technology, and other business intelligence research to support Entrepreneur-in-Residence and other SEED life science commercialization activities.

POSITION DESCRIPTION – Life Science Business Analyst
Responsibilities include:
· Conduct life science business intelligence and landscape analysis (competitive business, product development, IP) of early-stage companies developing technologies across the spectrum of NIH-funded therapy areas and technology modalities
· Analyze technical, business, and financial data using current or creating/combining new datasets
· Manage projects and develop tools, metrics, and dashboards to demonstrate progress and outcomes to leadership
· Support NIH-wide academic entrepreneurship and product development programs (https://seed.nih.gov/programs-for-academics/academic-entrepreneurship-and-product-development-programs )
· Participate in NIH and inter-agency working groups or committees, as requested
QUALIFICATIONS
· Bachelors or Masters degree with 2-3 years experience as financial or market analyst (life science or biomedical experience preferred)
· Knowledge of product development and commercialization milestones and lifecycle
· Experience with market opportunity and competitive landscape assessment, financial modeling, or life sciences business consulting. Familiarity with business intelligence databases (Global Data, Clarivate), investment databases (Pitchbook, Crunchbase) or other like tools (CBInsights or other)
· Broad awareness of the life science sector and healthcare innovation across all therapy areas and modalities (therapeutics, devices, digital health, research tools, software, consumer health)
· Ability to effectively liaise and manage projects with internal and external key stakeholders, both within the investor/business and technical/scientific communities
· Strong organizational, analytical, communication skills with demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities
· Interest and ability working in a fast-paced environment
· Maintain flexibility in a changing environment and communicate effectively across highly matrixed organizations
· Excellent presentation skills and ability to prepare high quality, thorough and concise analyses
BHI is an equal opportunity employer. Candidate MUST be a US citizen or a permanent resident.
APPLICATION PROCEDURE
Interested applicants should send their resume and cover letter to Lynne Brisbane, - V.P. Finance, HR and Operations at jobs@biohealthinnovation.org.

Description

Customer Trust & Partner Support (CTPS) is responsible for creating a trustworthy shopping experience across Amazon stores worldwide by protecting Customers, Brands, Selling Partners and Amazon from fraud, counterfeit, and abuse as well as empowering, providing world‐class support, and building loyalty with Amazon’s millions of selling partners. We value individual expression, respect different opinions, and work together to create a culture where each of us is able to contribute fully. Our unique backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our ability to achieve Amazon's mission of being Earth's most customer-centric company.

As a team within CTPS, Partner Solutions & Support (PSAS), strives to make Amazon the best way for Selling Partners to reach customers locally and globally and to operate their businesses, driven by the accurate and efficient support and solutions we provide them. PSAS focuses on both preventing Selling Partner (Seller, Vendor and Brand Registry) contacts through preventing issues based on knowledge obtained during our support interactions, and for handling those contacts with quality and efficiency. To achieve this vision, we invest in technology to eliminate the root cause defects that cause Selling Partners to seek help, build self-service tools to resolve their issues on their own without waiting for help from Amazon, and provide Associates with the tools that automate routine steps and help them deliver consistent, efficient, quality resolution, Our team includes product managers, program managers, SDEs, scientists, and a range of operational and other specialty roles, and we operate at scale with over 17K Amazonians in our team, spanning 50+ global locations, and handling over 50M contacts a year

Are you data savvy, business focused, with a desire to use your analytical prowess to help others understand Seller needs and drive change through rigorous data analysis? We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the PSAS Science and Analytics team. The successful candidate will be highly analytical, an expert with SQL and Excel, experienced with significance testing and A/B experimentation, resourceful, customer-focused, strategic-thinking, and have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines.

In This Role You Will
Be an important member of a team that improves the experience of selling on Amazon by eliminating defects, proactively identifying and resolving selling issues, and discovering seller insights.
Define the vision for analytical approach, reporting strategy, and new metrics for cross-organizational initiatives.
Proactively identify, analyze, and solve business problems with focus on understanding root causes and discovering significant forward-looking opportunities.
Dive deep into Amazon’s data to reveal trends, support machine-learning based automation, perform cohort analysis, and design experiments to test hypotheses and quantify impacts.
Work closely with Product Managers, Software Development Engineers, Technical Product Managers, Data Engineers, Process Engineers, and senior management to define and build reporting and analytic solutions that allow us to make data-based product and business decisions that make it easier to sell on Amazon.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating from multiple of Amazon’s largest data sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Communicate complex analyses and insights at scale to stakeholders and senior business leaders, both verbally and in writing.
Create and maintain tools, reports, and analyses which support senior leadership and various teams throughout the organization.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us .


Basic Qualifications
BS/BA in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field
Experience with A/B testing and statistical significance testing.
3+ years of experience of writing SQL queries
Ability to work independently, prioritize workload, and manage cross-functional projects
Advanced technical and modeling skills including Excel skills (pivot, vlookup, etc.) and data analytics
Experience using data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases
Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills with the ability to translate complex analysis into actionable recommendations
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability in using data and metrics to identify root causes
Proficiency in a statistical software such as R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, or Minitab
Experience with predictive analytics, data mining, and data visualization
Experience with survey research
Experience working with wide variety of business data sources

You will bring with you prior experience as a Business Analyst in Financial Markets, preferably within Trade Surveillance function. The role will involve working with Risk Surveillance and business stakeholders, as well as colleagues in technology, operations, and other business groups. You will assess and define requirements, and contribute to the shaping and delivery of solutions for managing Macquarie’s external obligations, thus allowing the Risk Management Group to effectively manage risk.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you, please apply via the link below.

About The Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.

Our COVID-19 policy

The health and wellbeing of our employees is a priority. We continue to focus on providing a safe workplace for our people, our stakeholders and those who visit us, and are committed to contributing to the safety of the communities where we live and work.

In line with evolving health regulations and many of our industry peers, we require all Macquarie employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of full vaccination in order to attend the office and to participate in external meetings and business travel, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, marital status, gender identity or any other impermissible criterion or circumstance. Macquarie also takes affirmative action in support of its policy to hire and advance in employment of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

We equip our people with the support to work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.

Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 17,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.

You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.

Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Jennifer Halstead
Sr. Talent Acquisition Specialist | Development and Alumni Relations | Johns Hopkins University

The Business Analyst in the Office of Annual Giving (OAG) at Johns Hopkins University reports to the Director of Strategic and Divisional Priorities.
This is an opportunity to apply analytical and creative skills to the Office of Annual Giving (OAG) towards the goal of increasing annual giving dollars, donors, and pipeline across Johns Hopkins University & Medicine. The role is charged with using data and statistical analysis to unpack, better understand, and advance different facets of the Johns Hopkins annual giving ecosystem, including but not limited to: direct response, The Hopkins Fund, leadership annual giving, pipeline, and stewardship. The role is expected to leverage data mining, analysis, interpretation, and visualization using statistical and technical platforms like Python, R, and Tableau towards the goal of improving OAG efficiencies and the efficacy of annual giving strategies and tactics.
The Office of Annual Giving is a growing team that currently consists of fourteen colleagues who provide annual giving services to the nine schools of the university, various departments of Johns Hopkins Medicine, and several centers and institutes, totaling over 25 partners. These annual giving services include developing comprehensive and integrated solicitation strategies that are optimal for each development unit and are data-driven. Like all offices and units in Development and Alumni Relations (DAR), OAG is committed to a donor-directed philanthropy philosophy.
Some of the initial tasks and questions that this new role will focus on include:
Use descriptive and inferential statistics to analyze program results and donor behavior—do these data points vary by school? How do factors like gender, class year, geography, school/division, past giving history, whether a donor has met with a gift officer, impact an alumnus’s likelihood to give?
An analysis of giving behaviors to unit-based vs. centrally-based fund designations. Who gave to these funds? Are they still giving to these funds? If not, did they move their giving to another part of Hopkins or stopped giving altogether?
Analyze OAG’s direct mail program to identify efficiencies and deficiencies in terms of ROI. Are their mailing segments that we should be discontinuing? Are their meaningfully ROI variances between the schools and units? If so, why. How do we maximize our ROI?
The effect of stewardship efforts on lybunts, sybunts, and long-lapsed donors. Are there discernable insights between schools and demographics?
Specific duties & responsibilities:
OAG is positioned and is expected to understand the giving behaviors for the base of support for approx. 25 school and units. This position is responsible for providing and at time finding useful data and analysis about the giving behaviors of Hopkins alumni and other donor populations in order for OAG to devise better strategy and tactics that yield stronger annual giving results.
Using statistical analysis, provide recommendations to maximize revenue for the flagship undergraduate annual fund, The Hopkins Fund, while optimizing donor count.
Boost direct response results through the creation and updating of annual giving dashboards for various internal development offices, providing details on revenue, donors, appeal response rate, ROI, and spatial trends. Train development office staff on how to use the dashboards, gaining feedback on improvements.
Track, assess, and make data-driven recommendation around the institutional-wide phonathon program as OAG contemplates the risks and opportunities of its calling program.
Provide data visualizations and data explanations to senior leadership and department leaders about opportunities to optimize fundraising efforts around dollars and donors.
Analyze data to monitor emerging pipeline initiative towards goal of identifying leadership annual giving prospects, as well as new major gift prospects.
Assess current data and workflow processes and make recommendations to design, redesign, and implement improvements to those business processes.
Examine current state and develop recommendations to create efficiencies around the pulling, formatting, and storing of direct response solicitation data.
In consultation with OAG and DAR leadership, develop an analytics roadmap that set near- and mid-term strategies for enhancing results analysis and reporting.
Helping to design A/B testing opportunities and then developing the dashboards and data visualizations that track and monitor the test results towards the goal of provide insights into effective annual giving strategies and tactics.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required.
Five years experience in data analytics and data operations.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree preferred
Extensive experience with Tableau.
Knowledge with R, Stata, or Python to extract, transform and format data and to create variables for use in analysis
Knowledge of SQL and Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including experience with Power Query, Advanced Charting, VBA & Macros, Pivot Tables & Reporting, Simulations, and more.
Experience with an analytics tool such as Salesforce Einstein or Qlik Sense.
Ability to organize and interpret complex data sets and utilize analytic techniques and platforms.
Comfortable working in a complex, multi-divisional, fast-moving, results-oriented environment.
Demonstrated success in project management while overseeing multiple priorities.
Ability to identify multi-variables needed to optimize engagement and predictive indices.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presentation capabilities. Experience presetting data to leadership team for decision-making purposes.
Strong desire to succeed and excellent work ethic.

Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. Jackson Lewis understands that embracing our differences makes us a stronger, better firm. We appreciate the importance of having a workforce that reflects the various communities in which we work, and we strive to create an inclusive environment where diverse employees want to work and where they can flourish professionally. In furtherance of our culture, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.

We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively-managed products. We are truly global, supporting our individual and institutional investors across a range of products, encompassing equities, fixed income, multi-asset and alternatives. Our high-energy and collaborative culture at Janus Henderson helps our client achieve their goals and ensures that our people love the place they work.

The department

The Global Technology department plays a crucial role in supporting the success of the business. We are responsible for developing and implementing state-of-the-art software and hardware maintenance to support our fund management, trading, distribution and operational areas with secure, stable and resilient technology platforms.

Overview of the role

Eagle PACE is the Enterprise Investments Data warehouse for Janus Henderson Investors (JHI). It supports the production of marketing collateral, website content, client statements and reports for internal clients such as Portfolio Managers. JHI uses Eagle data marts extensively to support these functions. We use Cognos for internal reports off the data marts.

Responsibilities for this role include developing business requirements, functional requirements, and work with quality assurance, developers and internal clients on testing. You will also be responsible for analysis and testing of Eagle uploaders, field attributes, and data mart configurations. Other responsibilities include working on both projects and production support.

The Investments Data team works very closely with the Investments team. In this role, you should expect a challenging but rewarding environment that provides opportunity for growth in the finance industry.

Duties and responsibilities

You will:
Develop business and functional requirements
Work with the developers to build technical design documents
Participate in design
Research issues by using the Eagle Pace screens, reviewing logs and data files, and by running SQL
Perform unit and integration tests, as well as support UAT testing
Carry out additional duties as assigned

Technical Skills And Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is required
5 years experience in asset management technology
Strong SQL Skills, Oracle preferred
2+ years experience testing business requirements preferred
2+ years experience working with Eagle Access EDM
Familiarity with the Eagle PACE data warehouse and data marts

Competencies required

In addition to putting clients first, acting like an owner, and succeeding as a team, the competencies for this role include:
Experience working closely with business partners
Excellent interpersonal skills
Able to work on multiple assignments, work independently and prioritize
Office equipment such as PC, telephone, fax and copier
May be required to work in excess of 40 hours per week and may include weekend/evening/holiday hour

Compensation Information

Annual Bonus Opportunity: Position is eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus award from the profit pool. The profit pool is funded based on Company profits. Individual bonuses are determined based on Company, department, team and individual performance.

Benefits: Janus Henderson is committed to offering a comprehensive total rewards package to eligible employees that includes; competitive compensation, pension/retirement plans, and various health, wellbeing and lifestyle benefits. Aon is looking for a Technology Strategy Analyst

Aon is a leading global strategy consulting firm passionate about the insurance industry. We partner with our clients to identify profitable growth opportunities and improve operational efficiency for their business. As a trusted advisor with unmatched experience in strategy, we deliver credible and practical solutions to empower our clients’ performance. Aon serves clients from offices in Chicago, New York, London, Rotterdam, Singapore, Sydney, and Hong Kong and works with guides from Aon's global network of more than 600 offices in 120 countries.

We work with our clients to understand their objectives, address their challenges, develop a deep understanding of market conditions and issues, and build strategies that drive growth opportunities and competitive market advantages.

A Technology Strategy Analyst will:
Understand Aon’s business and revenue model, and how technology can support business objectives. Work with the Senior Strategy Consultant to assist Aon’s IT organization with converting corporate strategy into technology strategy.
General understanding of broad technology strategy (e.g. services, technology trends).
Ability to present initial thoughts and acquire feedback to support the Sr. Strategy Consultant to generate wide scale strategic alignment across multiple teams.
Demonstrate strong verbal and written communications.
Demonstrate strong presentation skills including ability to synthesize information and bring a message forward.
Assist to inspire change management in order to socialize and gain acceptance of strategic direction.
Support the Sr. Strategy Consultant to develop a communications plan to ensure that all leaders and colleagues are advised on the technology strategy.
Assist in the development of practical roadmaps that support the enabling of technology transformation.
Contribute to implementing processes to measure progress against the strategy.
Build strategic progress reports for the CIO.
You Bring Knowledge and Expertise:
Strong analytical abilities.
Ability to collect, model, and analyze data.
Proficiency in excel.
Expertise in PowerPoint and the ability to produce PowerPoint presentations with minimal assistance.
Experience working with a global, team with multifaceted strengths.
Ability to learn and tackle sophisticated problems.
Ability to work with and build professional relationships with multiple stakeholders.
Performs well under pressure, on multiple priorities, and with tight deadlines.
Solid understanding of how IT departments work with and relate to corporate departments.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree required.
3+ years of meaningful experience.
Experience in technology strategy and corporate strategy preferred.
Consulting experience preferred.
Insurance experience preferred.
The salary range for this position is $70,000 to $85,000 annually. This salary range is an estimate and the actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location. This position is eligible to participate in one of Aon’s annual incentive plans. The amount of the incentive varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable incentive plan.

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; medical, dental and vision insurance, various types of leaves of absence, paid time off, including sick days and vacation days, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, health savings account, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, employee and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; optional personal insurance policies, adoption assistance, tuition assistance, commuter benefits, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits are governed by the applicable plan documents and policies.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

position: Business Analyst, Amazon Distribution & Fulfillment Solutions
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Amazon has spent years building one of the world’s most efficient and optimized supply chains. Amazon Distribution and Fulfillment Solutions’ (ADFS) team builds on that foundation and continues to innovate end-to-end supply chain capabilities. #ADFSJobs

In this position, you will partner with members of our team to understand the data needs of our public sector business and ensure that the team is equipped to leverage data-backed insights to answer hard questions and build strong business cases. The Business Analyst will identify ways to measure the customer pipeline and customer experience to drive business outcomes, identifying ways to better visualize data that is presented in our weekly/monthly business and sales pipeline reviews. Additionally, this individual will guide the team in developing new metrics to track, looking around corners to anticipate up-and-coming data needs.

Job Location: Arlington, VA, Nashville, TN or Virtual

Key job responsibilities
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Drive business insights and analyses into the public sector business to assist with our market sizing and forecasting efforts.
Partner with members of our team to consult, develop and implement KPIs, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements to meet business needs.
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. (leveraging Excel, Tableau, Quicksight, etc.) that will support our business needs.
Excellent problem-solving, task prioritization, and follow-up skills.
Ability to work well in a team environment.
Ability to work in an ambiguous environment with little guidance or supervision.
Ability to manage through conflict with a positive, flexible and professional attitude.
Dive deep to develop insights into our business which will inform our customer engagement and forecasting strategies.
Invent new ways to analyze data to identify the trends and gaps in the customer experience.
Interface with cross-functional teams to build centralized tools that will allow for rapid defect detection.
Job Location: Arlington, VA, Nashville, TN or Virtual


Basic Qualifications
Experience using data and metrics to draw business insights.
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools.
Advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.).
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines.
Experience with developing automated self-service reporting tools.
Advanced ability to draw insights from analysis supported by data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required.
Ability to analyze and synthesize large data streams across multiple inputs.
Curious to identify patterns in data and how they relate to the business outcomes.
Job Location: Arlington, VA, Nashville, TN or Virtual

Preferred Qualifications
3+ years' experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst role.
BA/BS in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance or related discipline.
Experience and ability to effectively gather information from multiple data sources.
Knowledge and direct experience using business intelligence reporting tools such as Tableau or Quicksight.
Proficiency in SQL and advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc.).

Job ID: A2019752

Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

BUSINESS OPERATIONS – VBS NORTH AMERICA, Strategy & Operations

The Analyst – Business Operations is a newly created role within the VBS North America Strategy & Operations team who will support the regional responsibilities/initiatives of the VBS team across the North America region. This position offers the opportunity to help create the foundation of operating models and cultural DNA for the regional team overseeing the Visa B2B business in-region. The VBS North America Strategy & Operations team is responsible for increasing Visa’s strategic value to clients, growing client and Visa revenue, streamlining operational processes for the team and enabling the team to pursue strategic growth initiatives.

This individual will play a critical role in supporting our conference and event engagement (including vendor engagement, organization of presence, content preparation, etc.), CRM management - Microsoft Dynamics, reporting and analytical insights and other business operations activities in close partnership with the Regional leadership team, as well as Finance, Strategy and Operations teams within VBS.

This position is full-time and the location is likely San Francisco or Foster City.

Specific Responsibilities
Support the VBS NA Leadership Team in multi-year planning, conference and event planning and execution of attendance presence, workforce management and CRM / Sales Pipeline management.
Develop and refine a core operations model, internal reporting, executive presentations, and leadership governance disciplines in order to provide visibility into the performance of key accounts through partnership with our client-facing teams across SMB, LMM, Government and B2B Fintech Partnerships.
Ownership of VBS North America conference and event planning and execution, driving our vendor relationships with relevant partners, supporting contract delivery of terms agreed with these partners, planning of attendance presence and management of go-forward contract decisions on future attendance.
Support key strategic initiatives, including program and project management across a global matrixed organization, including close coordination with Global and Regional Business Operations.
Coordinate complex, competitive projects with regional stakeholders and relevant account teams.
Develop the content and cadence of internal leadership meetings with senior Visa management and support external meetings with a broad group of relevant client stakeholders across the region, covering strategic and business development conversations.
Support the team on research and packaging of thought leadership content in the form of presentations, speeches, talking points, analyses, etc. at internal and external events delivered by senior Visa management.
QualificationsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS
2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)
Preferred Qualifications
3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
Experience in payments or FinTech
Experience in operations, Conference / Event Management strongly preferred
Motivated self-starter with the ability to work with a sense of urgency and deliver under tight deadlines/timeframes.
Strong attention to detail, highly organized, and adept at multi-tasking and adapting to evolving priorities
Highly proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word with a desire to learn and utilize other online tools and platforms (e.g. reporting tools like Dynamics)
Ability to navigate a regionally and globally matrixed environment successfully, with evidence of ability to influence outcomes across functions of the organization
Inherently excited about building new processes, testing and evaluation of operating models
Executive presence with strong presentation skills, understanding of analytical skills, including strong oral and writing capabilities
Flex Work Arrangement: This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both home and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office three days a week, Monday (Sunday in some countries where Sunday is the start of the week) and Wednesdays. Wednesdays are designated as in-office collaboration days. The third day in the office will be decided based on team needs and determined in partnership with senior leadership.Additional InformationVisa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.

Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. position: Business Analyst, Private Pricing Product Management (3PM)
details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Are you a curious, analytical leader with a passion for transforming data into models, stories, and reports to answer critical business questions that will drive innovation? Private Pricing Product Management (3PM) is looking for a Business Analyst to deliver continuous business improvement of the Private Pricing program on behalf of our customers. The right candidate will own the analysis and insights from data models to drive informed decisions for the Private Pricing organization, thereby delivering ongoing value for both new and existing AWS customers in the program. The successful candidate will have a talent for developing accurate perceptions from several data sets, a knack for creating simplified reporting models, and the skill to bring clear, concise insights to senior business stakeholders in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. The position requires excellent business acumen, statistical knowledge, and an understanding of the cloud value proposition/benefits in speed, cost optimization, and global scale.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Key job responsibilities
Apply analytics and business intelligence skills to extract meaningful insights and learnings from large and complicated data sets
Conduct and present analyses on customer buying trends, program effectiveness, and business impact to several key stakeholders, including Private Pricing leadership and the senior AWS leadership team
Build rich data visualizations to tell the story of business trends, patterns, and outliers
Test and challenge assumptions around AWS and Private Pricing customer value through an objective read of the data; build models to test Private Pricing’s impact to AWS customer experience and loyalty
Make recommendations for new Private Pricing constructs, or improvements to existing structures/frameworks
Interface with cross functional teams to fully understand and support Private Pricing
Direct, manage, and monitor data sets for continuous improvement and effectiveness

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field, or equivalent experience
6+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role
Experience using data visualization platforms (e.g. QuickSight, Tableau, PowerBI)
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Experience conducting deep dive analyses of business problems; identifying root cause of business trends, formulating conclusions and recommendations
Strong interpersonal skills and advanced ability to communicate complex technology solutions to senior leadership, gain alignment, and drive progress
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative field
8+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role
Experience as an industry analyst in the cloud space
Understanding of cloud commercial contracts, terms and conditions
Understanding of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

position: Business Analyst- Beds Network (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
details:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Agoda Beds Network team is a new department within Agoda, focusing on improving Agoda’s wholesale supply quality and inventory. As our accommodation partners are a key to our success, we work hard to ensure their success. The Agoda Beds Network team specializes in strategic account management, and data is at the core of everything we do. We serve as consultants and thought leaders to our partners, offering strategic advice on how best to excel on Agoda’s commercial platforms through innovative solutions. With the help of industry-leading technology, we work and collaborate globally to bring together the best ideas from diverse perspectives and strive in ensuring the best value for our partners, our customers, and Agoda overall.

The Opportunity:

As Business Analyst, your main objective will be to lead the analysis and data visibility required to identify opportunities for optimization for our hotel partners to grow on the Agoda platform. Your role is also to use data to provide transparency and efficiency to the Business Development teams on the ground and guide them in growing the business. You will be instrumental in ensuring there is consistency in data being used for reporting, identifying value-added data to help the business grow as well as using data to make strategic business decisions. You will be expected to dig into data to provide business insights, guide decision-making and offer valuable inputs to further grow our business model.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Analyze and develop reports and models we can use for performance tracking and optimization, drawing recommendations from your analysis
Build, enhance and streamline reports that help team members and internal stakeholders understand the performance of their business and identify action points
Perform ad-hoc analysis on business trends and results independently, translate and communicate results to leadership and key stakeholders
Provide input on ongoing projects and initiatives to reach business targets; run and assess your proposed actions in collaboration with the relevant teams
Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve team performance and measurement in the future
Hone your analytical skills in better understanding business and conversion drivers and how to optimize them
Prepare and present high quality weekly reports and business insights to leadership
Work in a data-driven environment
Use out-of-the-box thinking to develop and implement solutions to unique challenges
Work cross-functionally in a dynamic, fast-paced and challenging environment

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Business, Economics, Data Science, Information Technology or similar field
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in computer sciences, engineering, mathematics, statistics, data science or a related degree program. Masters degree preferred
Advanced domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, Python or similar
Analytical mindset, with proven track record in using data to measure performance and make decisions
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills

In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture’s clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today’s biggest business challenges.

Research, gather and synthesize information

Description

At KPMG, you can become an integral part of a dynamic team at one of the worlds top tax firms. Enjoy a collaborative, future-forward culture that empowers your success. Work with KPMGs extensive network of specialists & enjoy access to our Ignition Centers, where deep industry knowledge merges with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative tax solutions. Join a diverse team helping high-profile clients understand, analyze, and respond to complex business opportunities and challenges. Develop your career through a range of multifaceted engagements, formal training, and informal mentoring.

At KPMG, we believe nothing is more important than investing in our culture because its an investment in our people, our future, and what we stand for as a firm.

KPMG is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our Global Mobility Services (GMS) practice.

Responsibilities
Verify that business requirements and use cases are working in completed product through Quality Assurance process
Responsible for gathering client information to create clear, concise and complete business and functional requirements for assigned tasks
Actively participate in project phases and report status to Project Manager including feasibility, requirements, development, quality assurance, implementation, and maintenance
Update documentation archive with all relevant project documentation
Monitor the maintenance and versioning of project documentation and update project information on a daily basis to help ensure that projects are kept up-to-date in Portfolio Management
Use appropriate standard Firm Global Program Life Cycle (GPLC) process and documentation templates
Qualifications
A minimum of three years of experience in technology, international tax or Human Resources
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university
Able to work in and support a team environment
Strong project management and technology skills
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Strong quantitative and analytic skills are essential
